The National Guardsmen were never court martialed and the Alliance of Nations, now just a few dozen nations barely scraping by, had far too much on their plate to even respond. 

https://youtu.be/UWnE9sCJEgw?si=w4QsKUO9ZtHSx3Qp 

People protested at the government, but by this time “protesting” had turned into “industrial sabotage bordering on domestic terrorism”. Food, Inc’s main production plant in Hartford, Connecticut was destroyed in an armed revolt when the incarcerated laborers overwhelmed the guards and overloaded the under-maintained and over-worked 60 year old machinery. It was suspected that AVA had given the convicts the guard’s schedules and had even given them improvised explosives. 

An investigation conducted by the now miniscule FBI determined that a National Guard Armory outside of Springfield, Massachusetts had been raided, and the Jarret Administration started giving important penal factories and superfarms protection from local military bases. The Safeguarding American Resources Act of 2013, passed in November that year, integrated the Army into the security of Food, Inc production plants. It also merged the National Guard into the municipal police forces of the largest metropolises of each state. These new enhanced police forces answered directly to the governor. Most governors by this point were either fiercely Corporatists or New Dealer Greens. Several Green Party Governors considered consolidating their National Guard and Army forces into an army to rebel against Washington, but in the states where the Green Party had the most power, they had far more pressing matters at hand.

In the Winter of 2013, supply lines were further crippled as trains were constantly breaking down and fuel shortages forced superfarms to distribute their food to the closest city near them. Demand was so incredibly high that stores and ration depots could not be backstocked. Around Thanksgiving of 2013, after President Jarret held a lavish (by 2013 standards) turkey dinner at the White House attended by some of the most prominent economic and political elite, riots in Washington, DC resulted in a swarm of starving, unemployed vagrants breaking into the White House grounds. A contingent of Marines stopped them, but the violence was getting out of hand. 

The Jarret Administration assured their donors and supporters that something like that would never happen again, and that the President was working on a special way to mitigate the worst of the riots. In January 2014, the Jarret Administration unveiled the “Scraper” - a construction vehicle retrofitted by AAM to run on coal dust. The Scraper would use their huge buckets to ‘scrape’ rioting civilians and deposit them in the large container on its back. 

Even as lethal force became more and more common, it did not deter the most desperate of the rioters. The Scrapers helped but food riots had become vicious battlefields. The AVA bombings slowed down but did not stop. In March 2014, the Jarret Administration started to remove the Universal Food Ration in areas that were prone to rebellion. The governors of these areas, working closely with the federal government, offered rewards of food in exchange for information of AVA bombers and rebels. 

A huge number of Food, Inc factories had been damaged by April of 2014, and President Jarret became concerned about keeping his armed guards, donors and supporters in Washington, DC fed. The US had run out of a vast majority of resources and needed to turn to other sources. The Jarret Administration authorized Food, Inc to commandeer the remaining ships in the US Navy and survey the anarchic coasts around the world. They were given near-total control of the Navy’s assets but were advised to not enter the Pacific, as Australia and New Zealand had been extremely militaristic and had wiped out the entire PLA Navy Fleet in just a few hours. Japan was also just as gun-ho with their military after rearming during the Third Sino-Japanese War. 

Latin America and South America were considered, as many of the islands in the Caribbean were practically abandoned. Cuba was a wasteland of continually flooded coasts and cities destroyed by storms, and the surrounding islands, including Puerto Rico[1], were hauntingly empty as entire buildings had been pulled out into the sea by the winds. Mexico and their territories in Central America were in a constant state of civil war between the various cartels and the far-left dictatorship in Mexico City. Cartels in Gran Colombia and anarchists in Venezuela had recently provoked a civil war between the Sao Paulo and Rio factions of the fascist Brazilian Empire. The Democratic People’s Republic of Argentina, who had seized the remains of Chile, Paraguay, Uruguay and parts of Bolivia, was far more stable than anywhere south of the Mason-Dixon line. The Argentine Navy was using old Warsaw Pact era submarines, and they were flying a distinctively communist flag[2]. The head of the Food, Inc Convoy, Admiral Coulson, considered hailing the patrolling vessels, yet the only response they received was a warning shot. 

The Convoy moved to the coast of southern Africa and saw that the only areas that had useful resources were controlled by a distinctively far-right regime. In a secure satellite conference between the Board of Directors and Admiral Coulson, various board members debated making contact with this extremist regime. It was quickly decided that negotiating for resources would take far too long, and they were already running out of their borrowed time. Around late May, the Convoy arrived on the coast of the Indian subcontinent. The lands that had once been India and Pakistan had been thoroughly depopulated as a result of apocalyptic famines, drought and the nuclear war. 

While the US had an enormous surplus of 225 million unemployed citizens who’d do basically anything to feed their families, transporting workers to India would be too costly to carry out. So the Food, Inc representatives made a deal with the numerous city states along the coast: bring us scrap metal and leftover machinery, and in exchange the Indian scavengers would be paid in the corporation’s brand new product. 

This was where the US government and Food, Inc truly gave in to their inner depravity to meet the bottom line and keep their eroding power. They had tried just about everything to keep their populations fed and maintain a facade of stability: tofu-based imitation food, jellyfish and junk fish, cockroaches and insects. The CIA had confirmed via satellite photos and intercepted radio messages that China had resorted to industrialized cannibalism in 2012, and the European Federation the year afterwards. Many in Congress and the Board of Food, Inc (which was slowly becoming a circle as opposed to a Venn diagram), were reluctant to go down that route, but some vocal members claimed that they didn’t have a choice to keep their population under control. In an emergency, top-secret session between the Jarret Administration Cabinet and the Board of Food, Inc, a compromise was reached and this last-ditch effort of industrialized cannibalism was to be tested out in India. For the more ruthless members of the Board, this had been the goal of the expedition all along and had conveniently placed the necessary equipment in the cargo bays of the ships. The equipment was divided evenly between several of them so as to avoid suspicion from the crew. 

The “payments” were initially small, but as more scavengers succumbed to radiation poisoning and their supplies increased, so did the payments. The “Indian Exchange” allowed the Food, Inc to experiment with just how efficiently they could process a human body. The Scavengers would usually die an accelerated death due to the toxins in the prototype Ration Omega, but this was blamed on the radiation and the Navy medics euthanized them painlessly. Their next of kin were always given some Ration Alpha (reproposed tomato extract) and Ration Beta (a combination of potatoes and several grains) in addition to the Ration Omega to allay suspicion. 

https://youtu.be/BlnVP2_dIb4?si=2NMDlp2bYPKGsK2c 

Back home, AVA no longer the only domestic rebel group: in winter of 2014, the Pilgrims formed after a meeting on December 4th, in Boston, Massachusetts. The Pilgrims were even more dedicated than AVA: instead of merely disrupting production sites, the Pilgrims began targeting resources indiscriminately. Forests were razed to the ground, rail lines were cut, and individuals were targeted directly by starving people with nothing left to lose. During the midterms of 2014, an overwhelming amount of local and state governments in the Northeast had turned Green, and after the attempted assassination of a prominent Democratic representative from Maine, the Jarret Administration authorized an official investigation into the Green Party. Jarret’s Secretary of Justice accused the GNC of aiding the Pilgrims, and conducted a recount of many local elections in New England. Coincidentally, it was found that many of the state-level positions had actually gone to Democratic representatives in a landslide, and the GNC illegally tampered with votes. 

Former President Smith, who was now Chairman of the GNC, denied any allegations of collaborating with the Pilgrims. In the congressional hearings throughout the early months of 2015, the Jarret Administration and the GNC reached an agreement that Clifford Smith was to resign as Chairman in exchange for assurances that the Democratic government wouldn’t completely dismantle the GNC. 

As shipments of minimally radioactive precious metals began to be shipped in from India, throughout the rest of 2014 the Food, Inc began looking into using algae as a filler for their products. The Indian Experiment had shown them that cannibalism was useful only as a last resort. Using finely tuned specialized nets, algae could be collected and turned into a sort of green slurry which could be used to supplement the dwindling supply of vegetables. This was only in the conceptual stages, but as the Food, Inc Navy made trips between India and the United States they tested using algae. Ration Gamma, named after the blue-green hue of the cracker, was made from a mix of algae and seaweed. It proved immensely costly to produce, but even then, it was still the cheapest alternative. In the start of 2015, Food, Inc began an oceanological survey to find the best places to harvest plankton and algae. 

In summer of 2015, the first Great Heatwave hit the world. This was considered by many scientists to be the final deathblow to the US agricultural industry, which was already on its last legs. The entire southern half of the continental United States cooked in the heat, and dreadfully dry winds reached as far north as Alaska. The last vegetation around the Great Lakes dried up and soon the Rust Belt was a cracked, desertified wasteland. Hawai’i was declared unsustainable on October 1st, 2015. In actuality, the Jarret Administration wanted to dismantle the stranglehold the Green Party had over the state. Food production became so slow that the last emergency federal reserves of the Universal Food Ration were exhausted across the entire country. 

President Jarret declared a state of emergency, and temporarily suspended the Universal Food Ration. He knew that he’d need to think of a solution and fast before facing total revolt. Until the heatwave ended and the famine subsided, until more parts from India arrived, until more efficient methods of algae collection were developed… The United States had no other choice than to risk total collapse. In a top secret emergency session of Congress, on July 11th, 2015, the Jarret Administration approved Project Omega. Officially, it was recycling human corpses to be used as fertilizer to increase crop yield during the famine, but only the President (and Food, Inc) knew the full extent. As the heatwave showed no sign of stopping, Project Omega was extended to 2016. Then a secret NASA report claimed that unless a huge amount of people died, 97% of the planet would be unable to support human life by 2030 and Project Omega became indefinite. 

On August 30th, 2015, the very first shipment of Ration Omega reached American shelves. Food riots decreased in severity, but for the most part, everyone was still barely hanging on. Police forces were so exhausted that they were reduced to using ancient, mothballed equipment from the Prohibition Era and in some cases football equipment. The Universal Food Ration was slowly re-implemented in December, with the calorie ration initially small but increasing as the supply of crops increased again, supplemented by Ration Omega. 

Ration Omega was only good if the death rate was much higher, so the Jarret Administration expanded death benefits. For citizens that passed away, their next of kin were practically rewarded, and euthanasia became so popular that the Department of Hospitals began to start designing clinics for the sole purpose of euthanasia. The first Euthanasia Clinic opened in New York City on April 9th, 2016, and just in time: as predicted earlier by NASA, the summer of 2016 was plagued by yet another Great Heatwave. In places as far north as Washington, DC, the sun was so harsh that entire states became nocturnal for half of 2016. 

President Jarret became worried that the “Doomsday Collapse” in 2030 was coming sooner than expected. He began plotting contingency plans with his closest supporters in Congress. Alaska was projected to be part of the 3% land to support human life, so the federal government began slowly and subtly diverting resources to Alaska. A series of bunkers were planned to be built but construction would be extremely slow. 

As the election of 2016 neared, the Jarret Administration, faced with extreme resource shortages, a gargantuan population and rampant illiteracy, made the decision to rig the election in the Northeast and Rust Belt. Votes were no longer counted after Jarret and his Corporatist Democratic allies got the lead. Officially, it was a way of speeding up the election process, but it was the first step of removing the last vestiges of democracy. 

In the other parts of the country, the elections were still free but the media once again portrayed President Jarret as the superhuman man who had saved the United States from famine in 2015 and 2016. Jennifer Walker, the Governor of Arizona and the new Chairwoman of the GNC, platformed on an aggressively populist agenda of creating sustainable farming practices instead of intensive agriculture. She toured the Rust Belt and the Northeast (unaware of the election practically being predetermined) and explained in great detail the horrific conditions of the Southwest. 

The RNC, still barely holding on in the north-midwest, selected Benjamin Gilmore of Nevada. They had hoped that reaching out to the Southwest would steal votes away from the Greens. Gilmore used very simple words and platformed on returning rights to states. Unsurprisingly, a lot of the Southwest cared more about drinking water than state’s rights. However, all the momentum that Gilmore was gaining elsewhere evaporated when President Jarret revealed that in 1972 the Nixon Administration had broken into the DNC headquarters to get an advantage in his campaign. This shocked the last few hardcore Republicans, and they mainly voted Green in protest. 


The Election of 2016. Hawai’i’s votes were given “in exile”. 

The Election of 2016 was the first election that the Republican Party won no electoral votes. Gilmore did not even win his home state of Nevada. Governor Walker did slightly better, gaining both New Mexico and Arizona. The 16 Republican Representatives in the House won by default as they were unopposed. In the Senate, the RNC had no power. 

https://youtu.be/HHPZynI6pwQ?si=ysvT4gimokLjYlar 

With Jarret’s power secure once again, he immediately resumed solidifying his control. Using Executive 
Orders, he cut as many social services as he could. The Department of Welfare was reduced to only the Universal Food Ration. The National Relief was abolished, along with NASA. The remaining national monuments began to be sold off to collectors. The official story was that they were being transferred to Alaska. 

As more social services were cut, the intensity of riots increased, so instead Jarret sold off the rusting US Air Force. Food, Inc bought some of them for their corporate security division, while other companies bought them to break them down for parts. This was followed by auctioning off the rusting NASA equipment baking in Houston, and finally, repealing a whole slew of antitrust and anti-monopoly laws. Food, Inc, after being nationalized and broken up by the federal government back under Graves, was now finally free again. Food, Inc began buying up their competitors left and right, some of them including Jarret’s donors. The Greens and Republicans protested the entire time, but the Democratic Supermajority shut down any investigation. 

Throughout 2017 and 2018, as the resistance towards Jarret only grew, the Food, Inc began bribing huge amounts of Green Party representatives to sway them to their side. Their message was that it was too late to save most of the United States, and that if they wanted themselves and their families to live, they’d need to follow the plan. Most were skeptical, but as the months dragged on and the conditions deteriorated further, the Green Party slowly became just as corporatist as the Democratic Party. The Republican Party was viewed as almost extinct so Food, Inc did not extend the same offer. By the Midterms of 2018, almost the entire Party was on their payroll. The few remaining politicians with a spine stayed in the party, but always abstained from voting. 

In late 2018, to distract the enraged population, President Jarret began playing a game of political chess with Canada over the ownership of the Great Lakes. Ottawa and Washington went back and forth between declaring war on each other and chickening out. Both countries had huge aquatic parades in the Great Lakes, showing off their rusting equipment. Jarret was careful to always back down well before the potential of actual violence emerged. 

The parts from India were slowly running out, and in case another wave of terrorists destroyed Food, Inc Plants (AVA had slowly became more and more disillusioned due to the hopeless conditions) President Jarret decided to allow the CIA to destabilize the little order Mexico had left. Soon the Cartels were fighting each other in addition to the junta in Mexico City. 

Both of these actions gained swift condemnation in the form of the Pilgrims ramping up their operations. By 2020, several prominent Democratic politicians were killed in mob violence, a term the Pilgrims called “tarring and feathering”. Former President Smith was accused of being involved in one of these chaotic executions and was placed under house arrest for the rest of Jarret’s second term. 

In 2019, Food, Inc finished their Oceanographic Survey and the results were horrifying. Not only was algae-based food unsustainable, but the oceans were dying off at a rate much, much faster than previously thought. At the current rate, the oceans would be incapable of supporting any life at all by 2039. 

With this information, Jarret accelerated his plans. The contingency plan, called Operation: Eagle’s Nest, began to be set in motion. It was later expanded to include the secret recolonization of Hawai’i for the very rich, with underground bunkers filled with air conditioning, desalination, automatic algae collection and hydroponics facilities. 

President Jarret started selling off huge tracts of land to the rich and privatizing large amounts of federal land. And it wasn’t just arable land, either. Mountains were sold off to be destroyed in strip mining and lakes were privatized. This received massive pushback until water was included in the Universal Food Ration. Then, he pushed a bill through congress that mandated that every single city have a minimum of one euthanasia clinic per 10,000 people. He would later enshrine assisted suicide as a constitutionally protected right in the 30th Amendment. 

By the election cycle of 2020, even if the crumbling federal government decided to repeal the 22nd Amendment and have President Jarret (or even President Sweeney) run for a third term, those in power knew that the remaining politically active citizens would abstain from voting in general. Many had become disillusioned with the Greens as well, and the tiny number of politicians with their morals left had all become independent. The country was barely hanging together: famines, drought, desertification, civil unrest, and outright rebellion. Any hope of getting out of the Eternal Depression had long since dried up, most people were just trying to eke out an existence for as long as they could before Seeking God. 

For those in power, they knew that their time was running out. They could not save every American. Some of them wondered if they could even save themselves. Everything was running on fumes. Entire cities had been abandoned, and every day more factories would permanently shut down due to irreparable technical issues. A few in the Board of Food, Inc and the President’s Cabinet believed that their only avenue left was to wipe the slate clean and start over. 

But in order to calm the population, they would need to give them hope. 

This is where the DNC made the unusual decision to seek out President Smith’s VP: Roy Sanderson, the independent governor of Maine. Governor Sanderson was fully aware of the current political state of the United States, and knew where all the DNC’s money was coming from, but he believed that using the Executive Power that came with the Oval Office that he could mitigate the damage. The DNC ensured that he primaried unchallenged, and as the campaign trail picked up, Governor Sanderson platformed on policies to revive the welfare state and reinstate many of President Graves’s and Smith’s efforts to increase standard of living. He picked James Dent, a DA from New York, to be his VP. 

For the GNC, John Sanford, the Governor of Colorado, secured the nomination. He was one of the many Greens to jump ship during the midterms of 2018, and ran on a platform similar to Sanderson’s but with more of a focus on environmental issues. However, his brand of environmentalism was far more right-wing than previous GNC presidential campaigns. He called for drafting up the unemployed to be “soldiers” in the “war against hunger”, and to completely close off all immigration. 

The RNC was all but extinct, and the mayor of a small California town, Calvin Walsh, tried to run on a platform of breaking up the monopolies in Washington, DC. He also tried to form an alliance with the GNC, unaware of their shift to corporate pandering, and campaigned with them throughout the Southwest. Governor Sanford even promised Mayor Walsh to be his Vice President, but rescinded the offer a week before the Election. 


The Election of 2020

On November 4th, 2020, it was announced over radio that Roy Sanderson had won the Presidency. This surprised Sanderson, who was shocked at how fast the votes were tallied. In the end, the Republican Party had only 11 Representatives in Congress, the Green Party had a staggering 65, and the Democrats held 353 seats. The remaining six representatives were Independents, the last of the New Dealers. The Senate had 87 Democratic Senators and 13 Green Senators, mainly concentrated around the Southwest and Northeast. 

Jarret spent the rest of his term away from the public eye, overseeing the implementation of Operation: Eagle’s Nest. After a meeting of the Alliance of Nations in Bern, Switzerland, the remaining nations[3] all shared their reports on the drastic decline of the climate around the world. Although no one openly spoke of it all, all the world leaders knew that very soon, unless something changed, humanity would likely be extinct by 2100. East Germany proposed the idea of living in harmony with nature, while Japan advocated for mandatory population control policies. Soon, the various delegates were engaged in a shouting match, with each of them blaming the others for the state of the world. In the end, it went nowhere. 

On January 20th, 2021, President Roy Sanderson was sworn in. It was estimated that only 3500 people attended. Despite his attempts at a rousing speech, promising a return to the glory days of President Graves and FDR, the entire nation’s spirit had been broken and it seemed nothing could fix it. Everyone was either apathetic, numb, or full of rage. 


Roy Sandersons’s Presidential Portrait, 2021

In his first day in office, President Sanderson signed a slew of Executive Orders, such as undoing the “Of the People, For the People” Act of 2002, re-implementing the National Relief System, lifting Former President Smith’s house arrest, and began the process of investigating and breaking up the remaining corporations that held so much power. Unsurprisingly, the Supreme Court decided that each of these Executive Orders were unconstitutional and that President Sanderson had no power to enact such radical restructuring of the current political system. 

Present Sanderson of course appealed to the Supreme Court, but ultimately, it went nowhere. The official ruling was that, because of the colossal decrease in tax revenue due to the staggering 47.8% unemployment rate, the corporate donations from the “Of the People, For the People” Act of 2002 was the only thing keeping the government functioning. 

So in March, President Sanderson looked to other avenues to increase the quality of life of the average American. He submitted a bill through Congress that increased the calorie ration of the Universal Food Ration and also doubled the amount of water one could obtain, though only the water increase went through. In April, he attempted to reinstate the FDA, but it didn’t even make it to the Senate. In June, he tried to create an initiative to research more resource-effective ways of farming, yet that didn’t pan out either. 

His attempts at undoing the damage of the previous two administrations was seen as commendable, and caused the various terrorist and rebel groups around the country to momentarily subside their destabilization efforts. The Pilgrims actually endorsed President Sanderson, and vowed to stop all operations in Maine. As a show of good faith, President Sanderson sent Vice President Dent to negotiate an official end to all terrorist involvement of the Pilgrims and their dissolvement. However, after the Vice President was held hostage and almost executed, President Sanderson had no choice but to follow in the path of his predecessors and engage in a ruthless campaign to stomp out the Pilgrims and the remnants of AVA. He would find this easier than then two previous administrations, as a vast majority of AVA and the Pilgrims had become burnt out and disillusioned, with many of them dying in suicide bombings or simply Seeking God. 

In the Summer of 2021, due to the increase of the water allowance in the Universal Food Ration, a severe drought occurred in the Great Plains. This cascaded into another famine, and it was then that the President learned the horrible truth of what the vast majority of the population was actually eating. President Sanderson, back when he had been the Green Party Senator for Maine, had voted to authorize “Project Omega” during the Great Heatwave of 2015. He was told that it was merely the recycling of human corpses for fertilizer, and that it was only a temporary measure. But as his Chief of Staff told him, Project Omega was actually recycling human flesh to supplement the dying superfarms. 

In July of 2021, Sanderson made the unpopular decision to reverse his decision of increasing the water ration. He did not give an official reason, only that it was “unproductive in the long term”. In reality, he wanted to minimize the amount of Ration Omega being made. This was where the Board of Food, Inc realized that President Sanderson might not be the peaceful figurehead they needed to carry out their plans. 

Despite not being officially involved in the federal government anymore, Former President Jarret was still working very closely with the Democratic Party and the Board of Food, Inc to carry out Operation: Eagle’s Nest. While President Sanderson was dealing with the fallout of the Great Drought of 2021 and stamping out rebel groups, the Department of American Continuity continued their work. The Department was made in secret in January of 2021, right before President Sanderson was sworn in, and was classified as a government contractor so it was viewed as completely independent. Agents of the Department worked closely with Food, Inc to obtain biological samples of staple crops and went to great lengths to freeze embryos of important livestock such as chickens, cows, and sheep, where they were then covertly transported to vaults in Hawai’i and Alaska. The very rich not in on the conspiracy began to notice a sharp decline of availability in the already shrinking livestock market. The diversion of healthy crops to these vaults also began to cause gradual but widespread food shortages throughout the country. 

President Sanderson suspected something was happening, and while he did not even trust most of his cabinet, he still had a few friends in high places that still had their consciences. He entrusted these close allies (mainly Green mayors and the former CEOs of companies that had been bought out by Food, Inc) to relay any information they found on why large amounts of healthy crops were disappearing and not arriving at ration factories. Personally, Sanderson believed it was the work of roving bandits and hungry workers. In an attempt to reduce the likelihood of workers rebelling, he tried to reinstate protections on the worker’s rights, but with no way to enforce it, the Supreme Court struck it down. 

By October of 2021, the famine and drought had evened out. In an attempt to prevent something similar from happening again, President Sanderson requested a meeting with the Prime Minister of Canada. Here, he apologized for the jingoistic nature of his predecessor, and hoped that the United States and Canada could once again be close trading partners. In private meetings with the Canadians, he was quite honest and explained just how bad the living situation had gotten in the United States. He practically begged them for food, aid, water, anything they could spare: but his pleas fell on deaf ears. The Canadians believed that the Dying Eagle to their south had nothing to offer them. If anything, it further emboldened the nationalistic government. 

Meanwhile, the Second Mexican Civil War had spilled over into the American Southwest. Cartels and fleeing refugees crossed the border, usually to end up frying in the ever-expanding Chihuahuan Desert. President Sanderson sent federal troops to attempt to turn back the refugees, but this only resulted in more death as cartels began to engage in armed conflict with the American troops. The eco-populist Green Party used this as a rallying point, and engaged in a costly, bloody war to drive out the Mexicans from American territory. The Night War, as it was called, was named so as being the first major war to be fought entirely at night due to the scorching temperatures. It was estimated that over a million would die from UV exposure and heat stroke alone, with less than 50,000 soldiers on both sides dying from actual combat. 

Domestic refugees, fleeing from the war, would end up in Denver, Colorado. This overwhelmed the already stretched-thin government resources, and led to the Black Winter of 2022. Water shortages reached an all-time high and culminated in a gargantuan dust bowl that stretched from Crescent City, California, all the way to Omaha, Nebraska. Things were so bad that daily rations were reduced to weekly rations, which led to increasingly brutal and violent food riots. But soon, many became too malnourished to put up a fight. It is estimated that over 40 million people would die from the Black Winter of 2022. 

On July 31st, 2022, the Sanderson Administration made the decision to declare Denver, Colorado, unsustainable. Much of the Southwest fell to anarchy barring tiny, isolated enclaves of order. Strangely, the Governor of Colorado and 2020 Presidential Candidate John Sanford seemed unconcerned by the rapidly deteriorating situation in the southern half of America. 

Then on August 1st, 2022, President Sanderson received an encrypted message to meet someone at the Lincoln Memorial. Sanderson attended the meeting alone, as in late 2021 the decision was made to make residency in Washington, DC available only to members of the government and other high-ranking members of the political and economic elite. 

It was here that President Sanderson, in the shadow of Lincoln, met a man named David Sturges. Sturges was the last Commissioner of Food and Drugs before the FDA was dissolved, and claimed that Food, Inc was “up to something big”. Sanderson replied that he already knew the truth about Project Omega. Sturges insisted this was something different, that he knew where the vast amounts of missing food shipments were going. He produced a worn, yellowed envelope and handed it to President Sanderson only for a muffled gunshot to ring out. Suddenly, Sturges was choking on his own blood and slumped over on the weathered throne of Lincoln. “Eagle’s Nest” was all he could get out before succumbing to his injuries. 

Secret Service agents surrounded the President and claimed that he was in danger. His personal bodyguard claimed that agents of the Pilgrims had infiltrated Washington, DC, and were trying to lure him out to be assassinated. He was then told to ignore anything David Sturges had said, as he was a known collaborator for AVA. As the President was searched for any “injuries”, the envelope was seized and was never seen again. The last glimpse Sanderson had of it revealed the title: “NASA Environmental Report 2017”. 

From then on, the President was surrounded at all times by members of the Secret Service. President Sanderson was practically under house arrest in the White House, while his Vice President James Dent attended any sessions of congress (which were few by this point). Those truly in power, namely Governor Richard Holden, Former President Jarret, Governor Witt Myrow and District Attorney Dean Williamson, made sure to create some semblance of decorum and tried their best to make Sanderson’s time in the White House as comfortable as possible. He was President of a Country in Name Only, and the only thing that kept him in office were fears of a third civil war if he was removed. President Sanderson was still briefed on the daily state of the nation, and he played along with their charade. He was effectively a mouthpiece for the Corporatist agenda. 

By December, Sanderson was trusted enough to leave the White House, although he still had Secret Service liaisons with him at all times. He had learned that while under “executive protection” the federal government had completely rigged the midterms, ensuring that only politicians that could be trusted would now be in Washington, and the few representatives that had a conscience would be out of office by 2024. 

The first cabinet meeting he attended since August was about the drastic famine conditions plaguing the country. Even with Project Omega to supplement the dwindling food supply, it was still not enough. People were dying by the millions every month. Workers in factories and farms were collapsing from exhaustion. Malnutrition was weakening the immune system of just about everyone, and something as simple as a cold was now lethal. 

With this, Sanderson fell into a deep depression. Everything President Graves, President Smith and himself had achieved was for nothing. There really was no hope. Everyone was simply waiting for death to arrive. Sanderson would be frequently found staring off into space, or pacing around the White House in a slow, deliberate manner. Occasionally, the cabinet would bring him bills to sign, which he signed without even looking at. 

In January of 2023, the famine had gotten so bad that even the very rich had to cut back on food. Those in power debated back and forth about what to do, and ultimately decided that the only solution was to reduce the amount of mouths to feed. They would need to come up with a suitable excuse to get the population to go along, however. This was where the American Bounty Act was created. The State Parks, which had actually been sold off during the Jarret Administration, were turned into intensive farming operations with the sole purpose of working as many people to death as possible. “Lotteries” were to be drawn up and only people with no families left would be chosen to “work” there. All they needed was the President to rally the nation to their own deaths. 

On February 15th, 2023, President Sanderson would have his infamous “Seeking God” speech. Sanderson’s handlers of course had prepared a speech for him, and he followed it for the most part. It was only the mention of “worse things to come” that wasn’t part of the script. The few Republicans in Congress drafted articles of impeachment but in the end, nothing happened to it. 

President Sanderson was once again confined to the White House, and received only vague mentions of the goings on in the outside world. The last of the Klan holdouts had been wiped out by the Panthers, and the Second Civil War had officially concluded. The largest hurricane ever recorded devastated the South, reaching as far inwards as Tennessee. Reports were coming in that in East Germany, the National Communist government was getting increasingly militaristic towards both the USSR and the European Federation. 

On February 19th, 2024, the 41st US President, Clifford Smith, passed away from pollution-related causes in his private residence outside of Eagle Lake, Maine. President Sanderson attended the state funeral, and that was the last public appearance he made during his term. Sanderson was viewed as unreliable and was regulated to only a figurehead, with an emergency bill was passed to cede all his executive power to Vice President Dent. As he would walk through the desolate streets of Washington, DC (all his allies had passed away or were killed, so the Ruling Cabinet allowed to him a small degree of freedom), occasionally, he would see some of the 13 Stone Men - the 10 Republican and 3 independent representatives - give him furtive glances. 

By May of 2024, the Ruling Cabinet decided that there was no point in hiding things from him anymore, as their plans were already set in motion: by 2030, the federal government had planned to completely relocate to Fairbanks, Alaska and leave the rest of the country to starve. Already, he had noticed, Washington DC was becoming emptier by the day. 

In the Summer of 2024, water supplies got so low that for the first time, water riots caused more deaths than food riots. The police used lethal force to suppress the violence, and in places like Chicago, New York and Seattle, entire buildings burned down in the chaos. People began dying of dehydration in addition to starvation, and the police, national guard, and army saw record numbers of desertions. 

The Department of American Continuity, headed by Governor Richard Holden and Former President Peter Jarret, had already determined the results of the 2024 election. The last of the rebel organizations had been mostly stamped out, and it was just a handful of one-eyed monsters leading a country of blind, soulless husks. Members of Graves’s and Smith’s cabinets began to disappear, and then CEOs began to die mysterious deaths. The 13 Stone Men all suddenly resigned and were never seen again. 

President Roy Sanderson, the last man with a conscience in Washington, DC, decided that he had nothing left to lose. On the night of January 9th, 2025, Sanderson would force his way into the broadcasting room of the FCC and attempt to send out a message on the Emergency Broadcast System to call upon American citizens to rise up and take back their country from the Corporatists who had betrayed them. 

The EBS had long since been disabled, as the threat of external war had subsided with the collapse of civilization around the world. Sanderson was found at 6:49 AM, still rambling into the headset about Paul Revere. Acting President James Dent, who had sold out to Food, Inc long ago, only shook his head. President-Elect Holden, who was preparing to move into the White House, chastised Sanderson. “And what would that accomplish? There is nothing left for us here. The United States died on February 28th, 1972. We took great strides to make your stay in the White House comfortable, an effort that was clearly wasted.” 

https://youtu.be/8RMdWCz8P-Q?si=8hkQQdI1fc6N97v8 

Governor Richard Holden was president in all but name, being the richest man alive and the primary donor to the Democratic government since 2003. He lambasted President Sanderson as a corrupt and unhinged leader, and ensured that Sanderson would not have a hand in politics after January 20th, 2025. 

Sanderson would never return to the White House. He was instead transferred to a small, dingy apartment in Georgetown, and was watched constantly by Secret Service members for “his own protection”. He was told that if he tried anything like that again, the “entire country” would know about how he signed off on Project Omega and what it really entailed. 

Sanderson was found dead outside of his house on March 18th, 2025. The cause of death was unknown. 


Richard Holden’s Presidential Portrait, 2025

Richard Holden was sworn in on January 20th, 2025, though in practice he had been running the country all the way back since November 9th, 2022. His inauguration was attended by only 37 people, including Former Presidents Jarret and Sweeney, former Vice President James Dent, and the chairman of the GNC, John Sanford. 

On his first day in office, President Holden declared a “National Agricultural Emergency” and used eminent domain to gain access to huge swathes of land. In his first speech as President, Holden blamed the woes of the United States on Canada, who he described as “hoarding enough food to feed China”. 

The Department of American Continuity ramped up their operations significantly. The last dairy farms in the Midwest were relocated to Alaska, and anyone not connected to Operation: Eagle’s Nest with even a modicum of wealth disappeared and their assets absorbed by the government. 

During the Summer of 2025, entire states[4] were declared “unsustainable” and completely abandoned by the federal government, much like how the Soviets had done in 2011. Citizens were relocated to “temporary settlements” where they were promptly killed and turned into Ration Omega. The US military, or what was left of it, were told that they were executing terrorists. The soldiers involved in the operation were then put on riot duty and were usually killed in the violence. 

This was of course noticed by the remaining population, but the corporate media never covered it. Vague whispers spoke of entire towns disappearing, and to calm the population, President Holden authorized placing sedatives in the water supply. The malnourished population was extremely susceptible to the calming effects of the opioids, to the point that some people starved to death in a drug-induced coma. 

At the request of Former President Jarret, President Holden signed a bill to authorize “population control squads” in the biggest cities left, namely Chicago, Detroit, Cincinnati, Minneapolis, New York, and Philadelphia. Mobs of unemployed were drafted into the police forces, and given just about whatever was on hand - rusted knives, improvised, low caliber pistols, and lead pipes. Federal forces were fed false information claiming that huge amounts of AVA and Pilgrim members were hiding out in these cities and plotting to overthrow the little order there was left, despite both of the groups being effectively extinct. In particular, in New York City, federal forces exterminated an estimated 20,000 people under the guise of “gang violence”. 

While the “gang pacification” operation was undertaken in New York, Vice President Dean Williamson worked with the Provisional Governor of New York to investigate the “internal security leak” of 2022. Most of those involved were long since dead, and while it was clear that the “truth” was never revealed, there was still one person left who might be alive: Courtney Brown. 

Courtney Brown was David Sturge’s former secretary and later concubine. Despite there being no evidence of her learning the secrets of the company, President Holden had decided that she was the last loose end of the Food, Inc Scandal of 2022 and as such was to be found and interrogated. 

The NYPD put out wanted posters for her, which described her as an AVA mastermind or Pilgrim terrorist, depending on who was putting up the posters. For a while, no information came up, and the leads died down. 

Despite the purges, the population of the United States was still steadily growing. The Department of American Continuity had gotten perfect seed samples of all the crucial American crops, such as wheat, barley, potatoes, tomatoes, corn, lettuce, carrots, beans, and even a few fruits. Turkeys had gone extinct, and pigs were deemed too inefficient, but the last generations of scrawny, malnourished cows, sheep and chicken had been covertly ferried to Alaska. There was no biological diversity left in the continental United States, and Operation: Eagle’s Nest began to move on to their next phase: the eventual invasion of Canada. 

Population extermination squads were temporarily retired, and throughout the Winter of 2025, President Holden’s Cabinet and the Department of American Continuity began drafting up plans for the upcoming war with Canada. President Holden became increasingly jingoistic and inflammatory in his rhetoric towards their northern neighbor, and began drafting up huge amounts of unemployed into being cannon fodder for the inevitable siege of Ottawa. Incentives were made such as better food quality (with the Department of American Continuity finishing their operations in the continental United States, food and water shortages began to subside) and less cramped housing conditions. Empty farms throughout the Rust Belt and Great Plains were turned into training camps where the unemployed masses began to be turned into somewhat-lethal disposable killing machines. Criminals were used as target practice, and National Guard armories began to be emptied of the ordnance they had collected in 2005. 

As the United States became increasingly nationalistic and almost fascist in nature, the spark to live again reappeared in many of the downtrodden. They were told that while they might not live to see it, they could help create a better world for their children by taking the vast resources that Canada had been hoarding for themselves. Every hardship of the new millennium, every violent uprising, every food shortage and water shortage could have been alleviated if Canada and the United States were one nation. In January 2026, the Army had swelled to over 10 million active members. By February, it had jumped to 23 million. And by March, almost 30 million people had joined the Army, either of their free will or by draft. 

On February 19th, 2026, President Holden was notified by the Provisional Governor of New York that Courtney Brown had been found. President Holden, who was already in New York City (he had found Washington, DC to be increasingly uncomfortable due to the constant flooding and storms), was escorted by his retinue of Marine bodyguards to the high-rise where Courtney Brown was being detained. 

When he first saw her, he was struck by her beauty. She had an aura of both youthful innocence and the wisdom that came from maturity. It was here that he changed his mind, and gave her a choice: come live with him as his Presidential concubines, or be sent to work to death in a prison factory. 

Courtney, who had long been accustomed to selling her body to survive, agreed to be President Holden’s personal mistress. 

President Holden began to take Courtney with him everywhere, and even let her attend cabinet meetings. Whenever he tried to make advances on her, she would always come up with some excuse. President Holden actually started to enjoy her playing hard to get, and he would relieve his stress by flirting with her. Courtney had an almost uncanny ability to sense when the President was stressed, and she slowly wore him down into letting her become his confidant. 

President Holden knew that she was trying to wind him up or gain information from him, but what could she do? In actuality, AVA and the Pilgrims were extinct, and the only thing keeping the country together was the common enemy of Canada. There was no reason for her to betray him and lose her privileges: already, she was one of the lucky few to have regular meals of proper food, air conditioning, and all the water she could drink. In the off chance she tried to turn on him, he could simply kill her and no one would ever question it. 

On March 1st, 2026, President Holden, Vice President Williamson, and several other high-ranking members of the Department of American Continuity would leave the country for the 2026 Alliance of Nations Summit, hosted by Argentina in Puerto Santa Cruz. The subject of the meeting? “The Matter of Sustainability and Triage of the Human Race”. 

[1] Puerto Rico was declared unsustainable in 2005, along with all of America’s overseas territories. Evacuations were not offered by the government, and after 2006 they were for all intents and purposes left for dead. 
[2] The new flag of Argentina had the same basic pattern of its previous iteration, except the “Sun of May” at the center was replaced with a scythe and pickaxe (the symbol of the Argentine People’s Party), and the blue stripes were now red.
[3] The nations that attended the December 1st, 2020 Alliance of Nations summit included: The USA, the European Federation, East Germany, Poland, the Nordic Union, the UK, Ireland, the USSR, Japan, Australia and New Zealand, Argentina, and India. China, Canada, South Africa, and Mexico were all invited but declined to attend. 
[4] The states abandoned included: California, Nevada, Utah, Arizona, New Mexico, Colorado, Kansas, Oklahoma, Texas, Arkansas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia, South Carolina, Tennessee, North Carolina, and Florida. 


Part 4
The Living Death

The Great Solar Storm

In the aftermath of the Antarctica Conference, the remaining nations of the world were sure that they could ride out the total collapse of the ecosystem and the resulting mega-famine. All the nations agreed (or were at least okay with) that the amount of mass death required to stabilize civilization was necessary. Population extermination squads were an increasingly common method of reducing strain on resources, and “anti-terrorism operations” were being conducted in each nation of the Big Four. 

Yes, many would have to die, but to the chosen few that remained, they would have to carry that burden for the rest of their lives. Several heads of state, namely Supreme Minister Savateev and Chancellor Falkenhammer, began to experience delusions of martyrdom. Antarctica was a pipe dream, a fool’s errand, and as long as the various governments around the world had retreated to their bunkers and hoarded all the useful technology, they could wait out the impending collapse and recolonize the world in the mid 21st century. 

The plans were slightly different for each country, but every nation planned on retreating to fortified bunkers by 2038 at the very latest (that being Japan). More or less, the contingency plans all involved the vast majority of the population to be starved out and industry to be stopped for a few decades to give the remaining scientists time to think of a better solution. 

But that did not come to pass. 

On November 3rd, 2026, at 18:53 Central Standard Time, one of the last remaining operational NASA satellites detected an incoming anomaly. A massive solar eruption on the surface of the Sun had occurred, and now the particles were heading straight for Earth. 

The satellite in question had been launched in 1981 as a way to detect large scale nuclear power plants to make sure no nations were violating the United Nations Resolution on Human Safety and Nuclear Power. The satellite had later been used to detect the aftermath of radioactive fallout and gamma particles after the Sinai War, and later, after the Indian-Pakistani nuclear war of 2002. 

What alarmed the one lone researcher, sitting in front of a cracked monitor in a bunker in Alaska, was the fact that the particles reported were not landing in a way concurrent with the way nuclear fallout fell from nuclear bombs. It took him a few seconds to realize that the particles were being blasted on to the Earth, from outside the atmosphere, and in the direction of the sun. The projected peak flux of the solar event was a record X-57. 

He scrambled to report his findings to the Alliance of Nations, to Food, Inc, to anyone who would listen to him, but it was too late: the lights all shattered and sparks danced in the air. 

At first, many were confused by the sight. Some found it beautiful. Streaks of colors waved through the sky, no matter the time. In Sapporo, Japan, construction workers were blinded as crimson ribbons filled the sky. Children danced in the slums of Buenos Aires, celebrating the wondrous lights above them. Elation turned to fear when shards of charred metal landed in cities in hailstorms, and then entire satellites fell out of orbit. A huge, clunky spy satellite from 1967 landed off the coast of Wellington, New Zealand and caused three people to be swept out to sea in the splashdown. Larger and larger objects began to burn up in the atmosphere. A rocket booster landed in Grand Coulee Dam, Washington, and flooded the entire town of Grand Coulee. Abandoned spaceships carpet bombed the dying oceans, filling them with toxic chemicals and rancid fuel. Allegedly, the remnants of the Station for International Cooperation and Friendship broke apart above central China, landing as far west as Chongqing and as far east as Zhangzhou. 

All across the world, the tiny, frail remnants of industry and electronics fried in the storm. It lasted less than 10 minutes. 

Entire power networks went up in flames, causing uncontrollable fires in the towns they were located in. Power lines exploded and landed in irrigation systems, which shocked anyone who touched them. Outages led to countless millions being trapped in buildings all across the world. Children became permanently blinded, and an unusual number of babies were stillborn or born blind for a week afterwards. Communication lines short circuited for the privileged few still able to access them. Cargo planes fell out of the sky, usually landing in remote, isolated places with no hope of rescue. 

The fledgling solar and wind farms in Oceania and Europe fizzled out and never became operational again. Wind collection towers collapsed into the sea and eventually mixed with rocket fuel to create chemical chimeras unseen to mortal man. Nuclear power plants across the world went critical as various electronic components became irreparably damaged. Emergency services scrambled to prevent the reactors from going past the point of no return and exploding. Not all were successful - in Australia, just three reactors exploded out of the almost 2000 units of various sizes. And with them, over 10 million died and Melbourne, Adelaide and Brisbane were wiped off the face of the earth. 

The few remaining pumps and sewer systems in North America and Europe all finally broke down. Septic tanks were eventually filled beyond capacity and burst in the following days, causing numerous health issues and outbreaks of common diseases. The dying skeleton of global trade turned to dust as the last functioning supply lines broke down due to malfunctions. Refrigerators in bunkers around the world broke down, becoming ticking time bombs of disease and rot. 

And the most terrifying aspect was that no one knew the full extent of the damage that the event caused. 99.9% of all advanced electronics became permanently inoperable, and governments struggled to regain control. Military equipment was prioritized first, then communication, then industrial food production and water purification, and then everything else. In the various anarchic regions of the world, mainly in Central America, Africa and India, their scant electronics caused their electrical infrastructure to remain mostly intact, but they suffered different problems. 

In the few electronics that were functioning, electrical fires and system failures cascaded into gargantuan mega-fires that burned entire cities. Almost the entire Congo burned down, from the coast of the Atlantic ocean to the coast of the Indian ocean. The amount of ash and soot that went into the atmosphere blotted out the Sun for an entire month, and the last, most hardiest plant life finally died from the lack of sunlight or from being burnt up in a mega fire. Farms and greenhouses that survived the fires soon dried up as the atmospheric contaminants disrupted the water cycle, causing a mega-drought that lasted for as long as six months in some areas of the world. 
Part 6
Nothing Beside Remains

Night Falls on America

Department of American Continuity Safehouse located outside of Detroit, Michigan. Photographed in 2021

11:43 PM
07/03/27
Three Miles outside of Fort Wayne, Indiana

Dean Williamson hadn’t slept in a day. 

Twenty-four hours ago, he and his retinue of Secret Service bodyguards, along with Major Peter Morris of the Third Division of the Virginia National Guard, were attacked and waylaid by the American Volunteer Army outside of Columbus, Ohio. Having the only diesel powered motor vehicle left in America, using gas plundered from occupied Canada, his convoy was an easy target. Those that recognized the sound of a diesel engine were incited into a fury, and after President Holden mysteriously disappeared, many felt abandoned by the man who had led them to war. Many more felt the same when Boston, Massachusetts, Washington, D.C, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and Charleston, West Virginia were destroyed in a nuclear hellfire. The USSR, China, the Federation, maybe even Brazil… no one knew who launched them, not that it mattered now. Just how no one knew if the USA had launched their retaliatory strikes. The last remnants of the old world were dying out, the last breath of a world executed by solar flare. 

“Mister President, we’ll get you through this. We swore an oath,” Agent Wheeler said. 

Mister President. He had forgotten that he was no longer veep. He was the 48th President of the United States! What was left of it, at least. To think, only a month ago, the entire country was united and under one flag after successfully taking Ottawa. And now, it was tearing itself apart. This would not be his legacy - not as long as he drew breath. He would re-unite the United States, all 58 States, even if it took him the rest of his life. He just needed to make contact with the rest of Operation: Eagle’s Nest in Alaska, and they’d surely send reinforcements. 

The Third US Civil War had started on June 14th, 2027, when President Holden vanished off the face of the earth. He was not seen at the Presidential Tower in New York City, and after a squadron of Marines tore half of Manhattan apart to try to find him (or his remains), Dean Williamson was sworn in as the 48th President of the United States of America. Just a day later, while President Williamson was en route to New York City, he received news that Washington, DC was hit by nuclear weapons. Over the next hour, confirmed hits were reported in Charleston, Pittsburgh, and Boston, before Cheyenne Mountain lost contact with the rest of the United State’s satellites. The Atlantic Fleet reported that the nukes were launched by a submarine, and investigations to determine which country owned the submarine were underway, before communications were severed - most likely, he suspected, by the Pilgrims. 

The Pilgrims. That was a name he had hoped never to hear again. Attorney General Dent, overseeing American justice in the Ottawa Trials, was assassinated outside of Augusta, Maine and his body was allegedly on display in the city hall. The Armed Forces were trying to retake New England, but after communications went out they experienced setbacks. He knew that with his current resources, retaking New England would be a lost cause. 

The rest of the Northeast was quickly dying off, as radiation and acid rain from contaminated cities ravaged those brave boys in green in New York. If President Holden was alive in New York City, he wouldn’t last much longer. A part of him, deep down, was glad that Holden was missing. In those final months he was in office, he was like a different man. Cold and ruthless, he sacrificed untold millions to conquer Canada. Yet, when President Bouchard signed the terms of surrender, President Holden made no efforts to begin Phase Four of Operation: Eagle’s Nest and begin the resettlement of American citizens in the Canadian Arctic. Former President Jarret was to oversee that part of the plan, and come to think of it, he hadn’t seen Jarret in over a month. Well, he never liked him. President Williamson had planned on removing him from the Cabinet when it was all over. 

Shit, he’d have to make a cabinet. Major Morris would make a good Secretary of Defense, and Agent Wheeler’s loyalty would be rewarded by making him the Secretary of Justice. Would he pardon Holden though? He was not the paragon of American Mercantilism as he had made himself out to be. Should he be put on trial? Or would - 

There was a thunderous blast, and the M-125 McCain in front of him imploded into a cloud of black smoke and ungodly heat, despite it being the dead of night. 

“Incoming Charlies!” a marine shouted. 

President Williamson didn’t see anymore, Wheeler had forced him onto the floor of the truck when the blast first hit. He could only listen to the popping of gunshots, the thud of bodies and the clinking of casings. 

After just a few minutes, it was over. Major Morris came to personally check on him. 

“He’s unharmed,” Agent Wheeler said. 

“Fort Wayne is compromised, sir. It’s those communists from AVA,” Morris reported. “Killed three of my men. Good men.”

President Williamson gulped and took a moment to collect himself. “How many did you kill? Did you give them Dent’s regards?” 

“Recon spotted twelve. All wearing Green Bay Grays[1]. One of them had a Lawyer[2], that’s how they took out Pointman.”

“So these were Holden’s boys?” President Williamson asked rhetorically. 

“Father O’Callahan[3] probably twisted their minds from Patriots to this,” Agent Wheeler said. 

“P…Patriots?” a weak voice quivered, choking on blood. 

President Williamson looked down to see a scrawny, sweating man, lying on the scorched pavement. His blood was watering the long-parched dirt around him. 

“The only patriots a-” the man sputtered before his brains decorated the dead grass. 

“I don’t listen to traitors, especially those that kill my boys!” Major Morris said, holstering his sidearm. 

The convoy began to pack up. The two injured soldiers, Private Welsh and Private Brooks, begged for their lives before they were euthanized honorably. President Williamson gave them a salute, before their bodies were tossed on the wrecked M-125. 

As he climbed on the back of the command truck, Major Morris began plotting a course for Monon, Indiana, staying away from the AVA strongholds along the Great Lakes. They had just five hours before the sun would rise again, and they’d need to find somewhere in the shade or else they’d be cooked alive in their vehicles. Ironically, each battle had made the convoy look more rugged, and during the day they looked like yet another battle site in the Third Civil War. 

“We’ll reach the Duluth Bunker by the end of the month,” Major Morris declared. “I’m not risking any more men to those godless fanatics in Chicago.” 

President Williamson only slowly nodded. 

Off in the distance, they could hear the sounds of gunfire, screaming, and an ever-present smell of smoke and charred meat wafted through the air. Occasionally, large, thunderous explosions caused the trucks to rumble, but they were always followed by silence. President Williamson could stand the gunfire and sounds of battle, it was the eerie silence that accompanied it that got to him. Silence was the most common sound out here. Loud, deafening silence that made you hear your own blood pumping in your veins. 

AVA at least still wanted to live, even if their intentions were misguided. The nukes had made many give up hope. The town of St. Clairsville, Ohio, was right on the border of West Virginia and Pennsylvania. The town was completely silent as the convoy spread through, as every body was mummified by the sun and cooled in the dark night. The entire town had chosen to Seek God, all at once. Even the children. 

Loudonville, Ohio, was found burnt to the ground, completely unrecognizable. Hoagland, Indiana was even worse than St. Clairsville. In St. Clairsville, from what he could tell, the suicide was at least voluntary. Hoagland’s seemed to be forced, as freshest bodies were those of the National Guard. McRichard, Maryland was found deserted, with doors still open and even a few fires burning, as if everyone in the town had just vanished. And on every road, there were countless bodies, some of them heaped in piles, some of them hung up to be butchered, and some of them rot where they lay. 

And with every town he passed through, President Williamson felt like he had already failed as President. Sacrifices had to be made for America to survive, this he knew, but these were not deliberate. They were not for the Greater Good of America. They were senseless, meaningless, disgusting. 

Another explosion shook President Williamson from his thoughts. This one was a deep, blood red and sparkled like wildfire. 

“What the hell was that?” he mumbled, shooting Agent Wheeler a blank stare. 

“Fireworks, sir. It’s the Fourth of July.” 

[1] Colloquial term used by career officers to refer to the mass-produced gray fatigues used by the Army during their invasion of Canada, manufactured in Green Bay, Wisconsin. 
[2] Nickname for the US’s main anti-tank weapon, the M-80 LAW, produced in 1980 and never seeing actual wartime use until the US-Canadian War of 2027.
[3] Suspected to be the current leader of the American Volunteer Army, located out of Chicago. The CIA was unable to confirm before the communications blackout. 
Part 7
A Silent Earth

The Journals of Courtney Brown (Working Title)
