Revolutionary Nutrition Package (Siliao)
Produced: 1992-2027
Weight: 1,450g (earliest record) - 300g (latest record, only for inner members of the CCP)
Calories: 1950 - 490 calories, 120g - <40g of protein

In many ways, Siliao was what kicked off the whole "standardized ration” craze. Originally meant to be a cheaper alternative to importing expensive foreign-made food, Siliao was made for the worker in mind. It was a thick, juicy tofu steak, usually grilled and served with soy sauce and rice. It could be eaten raw, though this was not recommended. In the early days, before pollution destroyed China’s arable land, the ration boasted almost 2000 calories, being a worker’s entire meal for the day. It contained soybeans, rice, potatoes, duckweed, and later on, bamboo shoots and insect larva. The ingredients were blended into a thick, gray slurry and then poured into a steak-shaped mold, dried, and dyed with a chemical now identified as toxic. 

For many, Siliao was eaten over a bowl of steaming hot rice. When that became unavailable, it was then usually dropped into a boiling pot of water and turned into a mushy stew. Citizens were required by law to “enjoy this revolutionary meal born of socialism and gratitude for the Chinese people”, and ironically, for most of the 1990s, it remained just as nutritious and flavorful. It wasn’t until the 2000s when the mass-die off of Chinese vegetation caused a massive overhaul of Siliao. 

Only Indochina, Korea, and isolated parts of Mongolia could be still used for agriculture, and with over 3 billion mouths to feed at one point, the CCP had to seriously rethink the efficiency of their staple food. Soybeans were becoming harder and harder to cultivate, and the coasts of China were becoming too polluted to grow duckweed. Even potatoes became scarce. 

The Chinese Governor of Vietnam suggested using bamboo as a sort of fiber supplement, and later on, crickets were mixed in to supplement the loss of protein. The ration also forgoed all attempts at appearing like a steak, instead just being a bland cube of colorless edible putty. Unfortunately, this new ration, “Siliao 1.5”, had the tendency to melt in the humid jungle on its way to China, and efforts were conducted to try to minimize it. 

By the 2010s, this was becoming an increasingly hard task. Much like the USA, China was running into issues regarding protein sources. A vast survey was conducted between 2010-2011, to try to find the most efficient protein source with the fewest acreage per crop grown. 

The results were a grimly short list. 
People’s Nourishment (Siliao 2.0)
Produced: 2012-2027
Weight: 1000g - 250g
Calories: Unknown, no detailed records exist

Unlike the USA, where cannibalism was simply the cheapest and most efficient option at the time, China truly had no other choice. The results of the 2011 survey were worryingly small - just tiny amounts of fringe weeds could be used to supplement siliao, and all in distant, far-reaching places. Cambodian water spinach, Mongolian sorghum, and pale kelp were all ground up and turned into a sort of protein paste. This did not have the intended effect, and with no other choice, the CCP was forced to turn to a final, forbidden source of protein: their own people. 

The exact process remains unknown, though evidence has surfaced that the more fanatical leaders of the CCP used Project 444 to wipe out ethnic minorities. At first, great care was made to keep the true nature of the ration a secret. The ration, which had dull green hue to it, was artificially dyed gray to look like the old Siliao 1.5. Those who learned the true secret of the product were isolated and executed, with the idea of China’s main ration being made out of people discredited as Soviet propaganda. 

Due to the way that Siliao 2.0 was produced, using isolated, remote minorities and those who did not regularly partake in recycled corpses, the protein count was estimated to remain relatively high for several years. 

The secret ingredient of Siliao remained secret until the Chinese civil war of 2019. With it, the truth came out, and the leadership of the CCP was surprised at how well the populace accepted it. They were eating people, yes, but they viewed it as a glorious sacrifice in the name of feeding their children. Some elderly citizens, who believed they were no longer fit to work, actually lined up to be turned into the strength of younger generations. 

There was a grim, yet pragmatic restructuring of Chinese society. Everyone, except for a few high ranking members of the Communist Party, was now united in this shameful contingency plan. Everyone grew complacent. Sacrificing oneself so that their commune to live a bit longer was seen as heroic, akin to going off to fight in a war. Many still ate with reluctance, and regular crops were of course still grown where they could be, but in the famine-strapped coast of China, in the towering, overheated metropolises of East Asia, it was the only option they had. 

By the 2020s, China had completely forgone all attempts at hiding their true protein source. When vegetable paste could not be transported in time, people received a jellied, greenish blob of human meat, which was then usually added to a stew. It became common practice for families to eat their dead loved ones instead of burying them, with many believing that by consuming them, they were making their dead grandfather or mother a part of them. 

Those in the military were always prioritized to receive the more nutritionally valuable “old Siliao 2.0”, the one with all the junk plants in it. The poor, all destitute, starving and waiting for death, huddled around their pots of boiled bones and cried, hoping that those who came after them would not be forced to such drastic measures. 
Soviet Farmer’s Bounty
Produced: 1998-present
Weight: Considerable variation. Most specimens produced during the Black Ages were between 500g - 200g. Modern iterations are usually 750g. 
Calories: Considerable variation. Ancient specimens ranged from 1875 calories - 945 calories, with 140g - 75g protein. Modern variants range from 2150 calories - 2275 calories, depending on the region, and usually contain 400g of protein. 

Unlike the vast majority of items on this list, the Soviet Farmer’s Bounty is the only one I can say that I have tried, both a modern iteration of it, and a remarkably well preserved sample found in a sealed container located in the Arctic ocean. It tasted about as well as one could expect centuries old food to taste. Still, I’ve had worse. 

Finding that ancient portal into the past is what started me down this culinary journey, and as I traveled the world, visiting places like New Johannesburg, Great Yellowknife, and Old Mecca, I learned more and more about the storied history of what people ate during the Black Ages. My journey went full circle when I went to Old Mirny and had a modern, refined version of what Farmer’s Bounty once was. 

In the olden days, of the First USSR, famine and food scarcity wasn’t an issue on the same level as it was for the rest of the world. Very few actually starved, and only then, it was criminals and prisoners who were deliberately mistreated (which was still a significant number). The main problem plaguing the USSR in regards to food was actually nutritional deficiencies. Homogenization of crops, the rapidly changing environment, and industrial pollution led to numerous health issues. Bone softening, loss of muscle mass, and dental problems were all common. The Politburo, back when power was shared and wasn’t hoarded by one man, tried to think of a solution to help their people. 

The answer was Farmer’s Bounty - a hard, tough loaf of bread that was paradoxically crumbly and flaky. Due to a mistranslation in the original documents, the first couple million loaves baked had raw dirt mixed in. This was thought to be a way of combating mineral deficiencies, as some uninformed party member thought it would be the most direct way of supplying vitamins to the populace. This earned it the name “dirt bread”, which it is still called in some regions today. 

The bread was a slurry of different grains like oat, barley, rye and wheat, held together with flour, and with bits of potato, sugar, and molasses in it. Local variations included ground up bones from livestock, and dried kelp. All in all, it was edible, and it was eaten sparingly. Many still ate austere but flavorful stews, washed down with vodka, and sometimes, a sweet beet pie was served as dessert. 

It was during the Great Silence (7-107 ASJ) that Farmer's Bounty saw a massive revival. The ancient Yakut Empire (87 - 114 ASJ), before the great Ural Swamp formed and split Siberia off from European Russia, resurrected the production of Farmer’s Bounty after finding several factories abandoned during the spread of the Great Death. The centuries-old soviet larders, stocked for a hypothetical war with Red China, were running out, and thus a new food must be made. 

After the Yakut Empire fell to civil war in 112 ASJ, the fledgling successor states became isolated by localized swamps and raids from southern khanates. Each of the City-Republics had a different way of making the bread, and while some kept to the old recipe, others adapted. Baranul was known for using ground up honeycombs to fortify the bread and strengthen immune systems, while Chita used sunflower seed oil to add carbohydrates to theirs. By the mid 26th century, each region of Siberia had a distinctly unique variant of “the bread”, as it was called now. Very few remembered its ancient Soviet roots. 

Nowadays, the Siberian Federation produces a standardized, enriched version of the bread for international export, called the Urozhay. This modern version uses egg and milk powder to add further nutritional benefit. Many poorer nations in Europe and North America import millions of loaves a year, shipped in with Yarkino’s fleet of hot air dirigibles, earning the Siberian Federation the title of “bread basket of the world”. Of course, many Siberians still hand-bake the unique regional loaves that got them through the Second Dark Age. 
Japanese Ramen Ration
Produced: 1997-Present
Weight: 80g-35g, modern variants are 75g
Calories: 900 - 575 calories, 16g - <1g protein. Modern variants are 1000 calories with 75g of protein 

Where the Soviets chose to create bread as their standardized ration, the Japanese instead chose to use noodles. At first, the block of enriched noodles was meant to be boiled and eaten like traditional ramen. Early on, many added additional ingredients to their ramen, such as boiled eggs, chopped onions, and some youth were known for even putting hot sauce in their ramen. 

These quickly became expensive luxury items though, and many were content to simply eat the noodles. The government actually looked into ways to bake flavor into the noodles, which was met with limited success. The primary ingredient for several decades was actually powdered sweet potato and rice, held together with rye flour and then thinly sliced into a noodle. 

As energy issues and water shortages started to rear their ugly head, the government then began to develop a new variant of the noodles that could be eaten when mixed with room-tempature water, and still taste (relatively) the same. Powdered buckwheat was added to the recipe, and while it was by no means enjoyable, it was still edible. Those in the higher echelons of society, like the Prime Minister’s cabinet before the Great Departing, actually preferred to eat their noodles chilled as a way of cooling down their stressful, sweat-laden bodies. 

In the early 2000s, some people became so driven by hunger that they began to eat the noodle block raw. This caused a huge increase in teeth being lost, and the Minister for Health advised the government to rework the recipe yet again, this time so that the noodles could be consumed completely raw without damage to one’s teeth. Fluoride was even added to the recipe for a very short time before the country's supplies ran out. 

Over 200 million people, trapped on one island, would eventually run into resource shortages -  no matter how efficiently one rations and allocates crops. In 2004, the government decided that in order to keep the country from mass starvation, all agricultural resources would need to be consolidated into producing one ration. Just about anything that grew was dumped into large vats, mixed in with fortifying chemicals, and turned into thin, stringy noodles. 

Many silently protested, but in the end, nothing was done. 

The recipe for the third iteration of the noodles was brought over to Kamchatka during the Great Exile of 1 ASJ. After encountering the Men of Deer, the two societies traded supplies and recipes. Japan provided them with advanced technology to help mitigate the melting climate, and the ethnic natives provided them with food. A new variant of the noodle was eventually developed, being a synthesis of the two cultures: the Great Uniter. 

The Uniting Noodle had roughly the same ingredients, though it was prepared in a very different way. For one, it was eaten only warm, by tossing the block into a boiling pot of water mixed with powdered lingonberries and mushrooms. The Japanese added in a pinch of sea weed, while the Koryak added in a cube of reindeer meat. 

Much of the Kamchatka survivors and Japan intermingled until creating a distinctly unique culture, one that still dominates Japan to this day. After the Atarashī Dentō restoration of 765 ASJ, 13 Prime Ministers of Japan have been Koryak. 

A modern, contemporary version of the Great Uniter Noodles is still made today, though it is usually used as emergency rations during times of famine or given as humanitarian aid. 
Japanese “Fish Patty” 
Produced: 2004-2027
Weight: 100g
Calories: 2000-400 calories, 500g - <1 g protein

In 2003, massive famines devastated the island nation of Japan. This forced the government to re-evalutate how they were allocating resources in regards to agriculture and livestock, and the decision was made to wean the population off of meat products, including fish. Mass die-offs of marine wildlife, plus chemicals and metals poisoning the ocean, had caused many fish to become abnormally small. The ban also had political reasons, as well - Japan was worried that sailing too close to Asia would provoke the Chinese Tiger. Fresh-water fish farms on land were also considered a waste of clean water, and until more efficient desalination methods could be created, the decision stayed. 

The official reason given to the populace was that animal products could become dangerous vectors for disease. Pets were euthanized, and most livestock was slaughtered and then rationed out. There are unconfirmed reports that other animals and pets were mixed in with the rationed meat. 

It was not enough, though - many were still dying of starvation, and stubbornly refusing to eat the remains of their sickly pets. Some were found to even be hiding their pets and feeding them the highly processed ramen rations. 

One callous member of the government, a representative from Tsu, Mie Prefecture, suggested that they instead claim they will rescind the order, but in place of fish and other meat products, Japan will recycle the dead for the very, very poor. According to some documents that have been lost to time (only traces and references to them have been found, to this date, no one has found the original documents), recycling the dead actually posed fewer health risks than eating contaminated fish. The representative simply reiterated that “protein was protein”, and that it was only a temporary measure. A connection many did not make was that this representative was the son and heir to the largest meat packing company in Japan during the Glorious Decades. His greed drove him to lobby for the processing of human meat into rations for the poor, and while the decision was extremely controversial (passing by a single vote), by 2004 the first of these “fish cakes” were made and distributed to the poor. 

After the Great Departing, many in the government chose to die with the secret, but the Steward Society reluctantly kept the operation running. The high numbers of suicides and causalities during the Third Sino-Japanese War ensured the supply never completely ran out. The Steward Society however invested in research into desalination efforts, and with the drastically reduced population, small-scale sardine farms were made in the years between the War and the Great Heat Waves. Actual fish began to be ground up and added to the rations, but the majority of it was still human flesh. After major advances in desalination technology were made in the late 2010s, isolated fish farms began popping up in major urban centers. 

On April 4th, 2020, the final “recycled” fish patty was made. Japan’s population had dropped to only 74 million, and research into efficient farming methods had, for the first time in over 20 years, brought food levels up to a point where the dead would not need to be recycled for protein. 

In late 2025, Japan began experimenting with a unique way of getting vitamins and minerals: evaporated, filtered sea water. The resulting fine powder had lingering radioactivity and was still poisonous if taking in too large of a dose, but it was Japan’s only option for getting certain vitamins and minerals by that point. Batches were fed to groups of fish with their flakes: if the fish died, then the batch was tossed back into the sea and they started over. This bizarre process lasted for less than a year, as the Solar Flare destroyed the production line for it and it was not considered a high enough priority to restore. 

When Japan left for Kamchatka, the population that managed to escape the Great Death were so few in number that rationing did not need to happen. Salmon became the most common fish eaten in Japanese Kamchatka. 
Patagonian Sun Tortilla
Produced: 2003-2067
Weight: 100g 
Calories: 500 - 300 calories, 20 - 9g protein 

The Red Summer of 2003, like many other nations, prompted the Patagonian Alliance to pool their agricultural resources to make a bare-minimum emergency ration. Unlike other rations in this list, it was never meant to be eaten alone. Much like the local variants of the Soviet Farmer’s Bounty, each of the autonomous Patagonian Republics had different toppings they favored. 

Throughout the years, the overall recipe remained more or less the same, though the ratio of some minor ingredients changed based on harvests. Cornmeal was used as a base, and quinoa powder was sprinkled in when available. Powdered soy beans and other legumes were then mixed in to add additional nutrients, along with seed oil to fortify the product and make it last longer. 

The tortilla could be eaten plain, with nothing on it, but this was not recommended. Many would grill the tortilla and make quesadillas, soft-shell tacos, and crispy pies. Before the total ban on meat, and then all animal products, many would add ground chicken and shredded cheese. Some farmers would add an egg for extra protein before going out to work on the fields. 

Toppings varied from region to region, usually consisting of local staples. In Bolivia, it was common to spread a paste of mashed potatoes, spiced with chopped tomatoes and chilis. In Paraguay, many would pickle various herbs like garlic and parsley overnight, fry them in the pickled brine, and add them to the tortilla, along with a mix of popped corn kernels, tomato slices, and serve them with pumpkin jerky. Rolling carrots in the tortilla and spreading it with kale was a popular fad in Uruguay among those who were on the move between the many agrarian cities. In Chile, the cuisine was far more varied, as those closer to the shores had a completely different range of ingredients than those in the highlands. On the coastal shores, many fried theirs in fish oil and topped it with anchovies to tinge it with the taste of the sea, while those in the Andeans preferred more subtle, earthy flavors from various mountain herbs. Argentina had the most variety, with assorted fruits ground up into a paste and spread across the tortilla as a sweet treat, dipped in a runny tomato-based sauce, or grilled and used to make Soviet-inspired “Patagonian Perogies”. 

During the Patagonian Colonization of Antarctica, several crops ended up not surviving in the harsh climate, and the tortilla became less and less popular. The Antarctic variant of the tortilla was made with maize, corn and quinoa flour and amaranth was mixed in for fiber. Potatoes and carrots were the most common topping, though the settlers gradually shifted towards making stews and bread instead of the tortillas. 
Mexican Eagle Tortilla
Produced: 1996-2020
Weight: 100g
Calories: 400 - 200 calories, 15 - 2g protein 

The Mexican “Patriotic National Hunger Relief Ration” was a tortilla inspired by the Graves administration’s hunger relief programs, by nationalizing all of Mexico’s food production lines and consolidating them to coordinate against famine. Mexico’s tortilla ration is actually what inspired the Patagonian variant that came afterwards. 

The tortilla was made with maize flour and bits of amaranth mixed in, with black beans for protein and tomatoes for flavor. The tortillas were sometimes referred to as “Eagle tortillas”, for the Mexican eagle burnt into the center of the tortilla. The tortillas were regarded as extremely crumbly, and also didn’t last long in extremely dry environments. By 2003, they were only produced in areas south of Mexico City. 

Over 300 million tortillas were produced during the “Golden Age” of socialist Mexico (1996-2006), yet not even 100 million were produced during Valdez’s dictatorship. Instead, around 2014, Mexico’s military junta began distributing a maize-based gruel with chunks of bread in it. This slowly turned into a mystery-meat laden stew, and when Valdez was assassinated in 2021, the coordinated production of rations became completely dismantled. Many began to eat the food completely raw, the withered husk and all. 
Venezuelan Victory Cornbread
Produced: 1973-1995
Weight: 400g
Calories: 1500 calories, 50g protein

“Victory Cornbread” is a unique item in this list in that it was produced during the Glorious Decades and not created as a result of the Shock. It was created in mid-1973, as a way of ensuring the impoverished citizens of Venezuela (one of the poorest countries before the Crash of 1988) had enough to eat and thus might stay and build up the country, instead of emigrating to a place like Mexico, Costa Rica, or Brazil. 

Using loans from the IMF, China, and the USA, Venezuela’s government imported industrial equipment on a massive scale and began to manufacture huge amounts of cornbread. This cornbread was made with ingredients that grew in Venezuela, with the original intention of them becoming self-sufficient, however this never panned out. Venezuela kept importing more and more raw material, and while they were able to make some profit and start to pay off their debts, the economic situation kept many in the slums of Venezuela dependent on the imported food. 

Using the magic of space-age petroleum-based chemicals, the cornbread was enriched with a full day’s worth of recommended vitamins and minerals. Sugar from Brazil, corn from the USA, cassava from Nigeria, soybeans from Argentina, black beans from Mexico, and rice vinegar from Thailand were all imported in record numbers. A special blend of multivitamins, essential minerals and preservatives, produced by a company that went bankrupt in 1989, was then added to the mixture. Many considered it a wonder of science, of an entire meal’s worth of nutrition in a single serving of cornbread, but in a world where wagyu beef, caviar and vintage wines were no longer considered a delicacy but the norm, the Victory Cornbread remained obscure and only eaten by those with no other choice.

Over 1 billion servings, all packaged in hermetically sealed plastic containers, were manufactured between 1973 and 1988. After the Crash of 1988, the pragmatic government accepted raw ingredients as payment for Venezuelan oil. Some poorer nations in Africa actually ended up buying cornbread instead of oil. Production of the bread slowed significantly in 1990, and the last batch was made sometime in 1995. Government forces during the Civil War initially controlled the supply, but as it dragged on, the Red Hand Confederacy began to capture supply depots and turn them into anarchistic communes. Over time, these communes were targeted and destroyed by rival factions. Victory cornbread became a highly sought-after item in Venezuela during the Black Ages. The Red Hand began burying caches of guns, ammunition, cornbread and water, using them during the fight against Brazil and later the Cartel. These caches ended up being life-saving treasure troves for the survivors in the region (part of the Republic of Libertalia in the present day). 
Brazilian “Sao Paulo Soup” (gruel)
Produced: 1993-2026
Weight: 230g - 60g
Calories: 400 calories - 300 calories, 20g - 3g protein 

“Sao Paulo Soup” was the ironic name given to the government ration distributed to the citizens of Brazil. Throughout the 1990s and 2000s, it was given only to prisoners of war, but after the civil war started, it became the default emergency food for all civilians - they were just simply given more portions than prisoners. 

As such, the gruel was a thick, syrupy slop that danced the line between liquid and solid. The ingredients varied wildly based on the region, but a few things were common enough to be staples. The primary base was a mix of cassava roots and rice. In the early years of the civil war, soybeans were used as protein for the civilians, but prisoners were unknowingly fed the remains of their comrades. Some soldiers distributed the prisoner variant to civilians. When MREs were not available, soldiers would eat the gruel with a side of black beans and carrot shavings. The suspicious and untrustworthy nature of the soup made it easy for many of the rebels to eventually switch to veganism and eat Patagonian tortillas. 

Near the end of the civil war, when a majority of the civilian population was either dead or aligned with the socialist Rebel Coast, the gruel stopped being made, as prisoners were simply killed on the spot. The remnants of the military had enough left over MREs, and while they weren’t much better than the gruel, it did make the fragments of the government less dependent on farms. 
ANZ Standardized Nutrition Ration (Super Spread)
Produced: 2016 - 2091
Weight: 200g
Calories: 40 calories, 4g protein per 3g spread

When famine reared its ugly head, the Union of Australia and New Zealand was unfazed. As it turns out, their solution was invented all the way back in the 1920s: a vegetable spread filled with vitamins and minerals. During the first Great Heat Wave, even the advanced nation of ANZ began to struggle. One of the first decisions of this new unified government was how to deal with this shortage, minor as it was.

A few months of research later, and the Super Spread was created. Still using brewer’s yeast and grain residue as the base, various other ingredients were added: micro-algae grown in vats, ground emu meat, powdered seaweed, and canola oil. The spread had a salty, buttery taste, and lasted for centuries when properly sealed. 

Part of the genius of the Super Spread is that it forced the populace to diversify their diets. The Super Spread was frequently added to bread, but some people spread it over emu drumsticks. More exotic ways of consuming it included making quesadillas and crepes with the spread mixed into the dough. 

When Australia began to colonize Antarctica, the Super Spread’s recipe was gradually changed to be adapted to the new availability of resources. Emu meat was replaced with soybean butter and the algae was replaced with powdered pumpkin seeds. As the settlers in Antarctica adapted to the changing conditions, the Super Spread slowly evolved into a pumpkin-flavored jelly that could be eaten raw. 
Commonwealth Kaszanka (blood sausage)
Produced: 2015-2035
Weight: 200g
Calories: 550 calories, 30g protein 

The Commonwealth Kaszanka was created after the Beer Revolution, when President Kowalski used his business connections to scrape together a barely-edible ration for the very poor. It was better than the alternative the communists had planned for them: something along the lines of “The People’s Long Pork”. 
This “Polish Pork” was still made, though never ever fed to other members of the Commonwealth - agitators were turned into processed crackers and sold abroad to the nations desperate enough. The Federation in particular was their biggest customer, giving Poland old weapons, in an effort to keep Moscow, Stockholm, Warsaw, and Berlin all at each other’s throats. 

Still, the kaszanka helped the Polish people limp through the Black Ages and into the Great Silence. Despite being called a blood sausage, the Kaszanka actually lacked blood. It was a thin, delicate tube of ground mushrooms and seed pastes molded to feel somewhat like a sausage, and filled with groats of all types of grains. Potatoes were then shoved in, and finally, it was soaked with beet juice to at least pretend like it was made with blood. In fact, the food was ironically vegan. 

There were some who resented this. 

Underground “meat rings” sprung up across occupied Hungary, leading to the Budapest Massacre of 2028. Poland, running from the sea and the vengeful Nordic Army, looked to the East and took much of what used to be the USSR. By 2033, Poland had taken over and annexed the Baltic States, Belarus, and parts of Ukraine and Russia. They still control this region to this day. In antiquity, their reach stretched all the way to Moscow. 

Their reason for the vast annexation was to get access to the vast majority of habitable land in Eastern Europe. Long pork would be the next, inevitable step, and rather than stoop to that level, the survivors of WWIII took the fertile eastern lands as the spoils of war. Soon, the blood sausage was replaced with a new, protein rich version, using fly cultures, rat bones and other animal products! Fun! In 2035, the government of Greater Poland unveiled a brand new blood sausage: one that had actual blood in it. 

At long last, Poland was yet again wealthy enough to feed the poor the parts of livestock the rich didn’t want. 
Europa’s Staatesgenshek (borsht) 
Produced: 2015-2035
Weight: 500g
Calories: 1250 - 750 calories, 53 - 19g protein

After the German-Soviet Split, the Democratic Republic of Germany internally reformed into the State of Europa. Their ideology shifted away from Soviet-inspired communism to a unique blend of nationalism, Marxism, and environmentalism. Using the Great Heat Wave to take complete control of all land allocation, irrigation and labor, Chancellor Volkenhammer championed harsh and extreme reforms. 

“Calorie theft” became a crime punishable by “environmental re-education”, which essentially was a polite euphemism for being worked to death in a state-owned green house. Because East Germany and Czechia were much smaller than compared to the Polish Commonwealth, the Nordic Union or even the United Kingdom, arable land was prioritized above all else. The countryside was completely evacuated, and turned into a sprawling maze of irrigation canals, hydroelectric dams, and desalination plants. Farms doubled as military outposts, and a massive wall was built between the Federation and East Germany. The Stasi began to focus on eco-terrorists and smugglers rather than political opponents. 

And who did Europa blame for the horrible state of the world? Pretty much everyone but them. The Soviets, the Nordics, the Polish, their corrupt brothers in the West, the Anglos, the Americans, and the Chinese. “New Marxism”, as the ideology became called, rejected the idea that industrial progress always benefitted the worker - instead, because nature was the ultimate source of all industry, the working class must evolve in pace with nature or else end up like the rest of the world. Certain professions, like coal miners and gas workers, were no longer allowed to unionize. Instead, farmers and factory workers became the dominant factions within the government. Farmers in particular gained large amounts of power. 

Research conducted throughout 2015 resulted in the creation of a totally unique and original creation: the Staatesgenshek, which is allegedly the “real” borscht. According to ancient myths, using beets to create soup was actually stolen by Russian invaders who took the idea from hard-working German proto-Marxists. 

This Germanic offshoot of borscht used beets as its main stock, but also added in bits of cabbage, along with powdered rutabaga and parsnip when supplies permitted. Cream of rye was mixed in, along with chunks of potatoes and powdered soybeans. The most important ingredient was actually a tiny dash of mustard, and it was considered to be “false borscht” without it. Crusty bread was served with the soup, though sometimes the bread would be sliced into chunks and mixed with the broth. 
Ethiopian Injera
Produced: 2019-2223
Weight: Varied, ranged from ~60g and 140g
Calories: Varied, ranged from ~260 calories and 940 calories, 13g to <1g protein

Ethiopian injera was not a combined effort of several countries to tackle famine. Instead, it spread as a cultural product. The Great Lakes of Africa provided irrigation water for all of the common staples: teff, sorghum, millet and cassava provided the base, and ground up locusts and powdered fish scales were usually mixed in for added fortification. Some believed that adding in a pinch of gunpowder made one stronger and fearless. 

The injera spread across Africa, following the supply lines of the Water Lords. It was given as gifts to merchants and in tribute to raiders. Caravans transporting it reached as far south as the Middle Congo and as far east as the Great Lake of Chad. In times of famine, the lesser Kantiba (rulers of communities but not powerful enough to control multiple towns) would hand out injera to the farmers and serfs, and the social contract (sometimes called the Way of Water) was maintained. 

Injera was also used in rituals for the New Ethiopian Church, a unique blend of Christianity, neo-paganism, and Islam. Women ate the injera at certain times of the day (usually at dusk) as it was believed to help with fertility. Crops that would later become injera were blessed routinely by local priests, and in the 2100s, it became taboo to build churches on fertile land. Priests claimed that injera was made to “honor the skin of God”, and to eat it is to seek holiness. For many, it was a life giving staple. 

Injera was eaten with a selection of vegetables, meat, and sometimes as a bread bowl for soups. Eating a fruit, rolled in injera, was a common breakfast. Fried potatoes were commonly served at lunch, and whatever protein was at hand (chicken, cow, human) was served at the end of the day. Lords, soldiers and laborers were given larger portions of protein, while women, slaves and merchants were given minimal portions. 

Injera eventually fell out of favor in the 23rd century during the Red Sea Crusades, and the New Ethiopian Church was dismantled. Because the bread had been ritualized so heavily, it was forbidden by the Turkish Caliphate. 

In the modern day, the baking of bread is still considered taboo in some parts of Abyssinia. 

THE LONDON TIMES
12th May 2003

Return of the Ripper: brutal copycat murders terrify London

WHITECHAPEL, TOWER HAMLETS, LONDON - George Cromey, technician at the coal-fired Shadwell Power Plant, was just returning from his daily shift, having worked three hours overtime to fix a fault on one of the turbines. At around eleven at night, having picked up a package of food from the local store, he arrived at his home on the newly-built King John Estate. He entered the property, only to find outside his front door the corpse of a young woman in her forties with a knife wedged in her back and drying blood sprayed on the wooden floor. Immediately, he dialled 999 on the estate phone and a police unit arrived fifteen minutes later, but by that time the killer had long gone. Upon further examination, the woman - a prostitute named Mary Wilkins - was found to have been dead for an hour, and had overly many stab wounds, 37 to be exact, primarily in the chest and abdomen. Normally, the fingerprints on the knife would be matched to a database, but recent budget cuts to the police have prevented this from happening and the culprit being found.
Readers may be mistaken to think this was from the year of 1888, when Jack the Ripper roamed the East End’s streets, when in actuality this case took place three weeks ago, and was largely unreported by outlets until now. Since then, five other murders have been reported, all having disturbing similarities. The victims were female prostitutes, they were middle-aged, and were killed with a sickening level of brutality, with major incisions and mutilations in the throat and the abdomen. Our more knowledgeable readers would recognize these to also be similarities to the Whitechapel murders of 1888, conducted by an unknown person commonly known as Jack the Ripper (despite the name coming from a hoax letter).
It is thus clear to the police and to all that these are copycat murders, performed by a psychopath whose motives lie in the shadows. You could argue this is completely wrong, these murders are not connected, after all, Whitechapel, already a hotspot of crime, recorded a record 51 murders last year, likely many more in reality. Yet almost none of them have the same sadistic brutality inflicted on them, and the cases are all too similar to not be related. This is not the first time copycat murders were attempted in the area - in 2001 a prostitute was found dead with similar injuries, and a message made in blood titled “RIPPER” was drawn on the wall. The culprit, a 53-year-old mentally ill man, was caught the following day. It is unknown whether the motive and culprit in this case is similar, however. The police publicly believe this is the most likely scenario, however.
The area of Whitechapel, as well as much of East London, looks comparatively different from the late 19th century, however 

The European Federation sourcebook
Containing never seen before recordings, journal entries, and other sources from people around the Federation throughout its history.

The Birth of the Federation
Summary
The end of the Brussels Conference was a momentous moment in European history. The topic of a united European Federation had been increasingly discussed during the Fabulous Decades, as European governments cooperated furthermore, yet it was never seriously debated a possibility, likely due to the (relatively) short duration of prosperity. Following the Crash, and the beginning of the Red Decades, as all of Western Europe elected socialist governments and suffered with extortionate energy prices and devastating heatwaves, nations started genuinely discussing it as a possibility for the continent’s survival. The idea was becoming increasingly popular among the public following America’s financial and nutritional bailout of Europe in the Red Summer, and the fear that Europe would become an American puppet as the climate crisis worsened.

The Brussels Conference, which was intended to decide the fate of the European Economic Community (EEC) ended on Monday the 7th of June 1993 with the announcement of the formation of the European Federation among members of the EEC. The announcement produced a feeling of hope among the European people, even on the extreme, as they felt Europe would finally be able to stand on the level of the superpowers and weather the economic and environmental crises. This short-lived optimism continued after the founding of the Federation at the beginning of March 1994, into the following year before reality set in and Europe faced it’s first major challenges.

Extract from the Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung (Frankfurt General Newspaper), 1.6.1993
Translated from its original script in German
AFTER FIRST WEEK, BRUSSELS CONFERENCE TALKS CONTINUE, FATE OF EEC YET TO BE DECIDED
BRUSSELS, BELGIUM - The Brussels Conference has now entered its seventh day, with talks between the heads of state and government of the European Economic Community still ongoing. News coming out of the conference continues to be sparse, the organisers having chosen to hold it behind closed doors to prevent the spread of rumour. When world leaders exit the Charlemagne Building and head back to their hotels as the days end, they and their aides still refuse to comment on the course of the conference, giving only small, noncommittal hints such as “Progress is going well” or “Talks have been slightly bumpy”. As Western Europe and the world undergoes its greatest crisis in modern history, expectations are high and the public cautiously optimistic of the results.

Opinion from Europe’s executives have been scarce, but discussion among the legislature has been much more widespread. Opinion across the German political spectrum remains positive to the conference and negotiations. While Chancellor Kruspe, who is heavily involved in the conference, has remained tight-lipped as a result, the SPD’s Vice President of the Bundestag Menno Ahlers gave a speech to the Bundestag yesterday evening, stressing the “dire importance for a successful outcome to the conference” and that “Europe may need something akin to complete federalisation if it wants to survive the coming years”. His position is radical compared to many of his own party’s members of the Bundestag, with 23 members signing a letter to the Chancellor that was sent on Sunday, warning of the risks of a federalised Europe, and its potential impact on “individual and workers’ freedom”. Kruspe has tried to balance out the desires of the left and right of the SPD in his tenure as head of the party, but this schism may turn out to be one of the more challenging ones to overcome. The CDU, CSU, and FDP have also reacted positively to the negotiations, despite some conflict within the former two, meaning the outcome of the conference has near unanimous support in the Bundestag. In other nations, reactions have also been generally positive. There is, however, a brewing split within the French Communist Party, whose leader and President of France has gone against the wishes of much of her party’s base by attending the conference. There is additionally much dispute within the governing Labour Party in the United Kingdom, which contains a large Eurosceptic faction, and there has been much controversy in Italy’s political scene over the negotiations.

The conference was originally held to decide the future of the EEC as Western Europe battles the aftermath of the Crash and accelerating global climate change, however the closed doors format of it has unintentionally created the mass spread of rumour among the public this past week. These range from the expansion of the role of the EEC to cover migration and foreign policy to create a “European Union”, to the federalisation of Western Europe to create a “European Federation”, to the EEC applying to join the Warsaw Pact. The Charlemagne Building yesterday at midday was surrounded by a few thousand protestors bearing the German tricolour and chanting anti-federalisation slogans such as “Preserve Germany’s independence” and “We don’t need a Federation”. Despite polls showing the vast majority of Germans in favour of a Federation, and even more in favour of an expansion of the EEC’s power, the numerous protests outside the conference displays there is a large section of the population that are strongly against this, and could pose a threat to the practically inevitable increasing federalisation of Western Europe.

Nevertheless, despite the various political challenges hovering over the conference, Western Europe’s leaders are still hard at work, engaging in tireless negotiations and talks to work out a new deal for Europe. The future of the... (continued on page ---) (text illegible)

A NEW EUROPEAN ORDER - What if the NEF won in 1999?
This is a scenario I’ve had in my head for quite a while that I personally find interesting, and will try write out to get myself back into the TL. It will be a collection of my thoughts on how it will affect different areas of the Federation and the lasting consequences of it. In the original scenario, the 1999 European federal election had the “socialist” PES keeping power, however with a reduced vote share and a massive surge for the far-right NEF. This alternate scenario has the NEF, in a shock event, gain the most seats and form a coalition with the dying conservative EPP, which will do anything to maintain relevancy.

Background - What is the NEF?
The NEF (National European Front) was a fusion of various Western European far-right parties following the creation of the Federation in 1994. These include France’s National Front, Germany’s National Democratic Party and Italy’s Italian Social Movement, alongside a variety of others. In their 1999 manifesto “For a New European Order”, they promised:

-An increasing decentralisation of the Federation and more powers given to the state governments
-A zero-tolerance policy on immigration, to “protect Europe’s borders”
-Mass deportations of illegal immigrants, and “renewed efforts to protect Europe’s cultures”
-Removal of “anti-European” judges from the courts and the establishment of a “Judicial Aptitude Test” to filter out “unpatriotic” judges
-Increased funding to the police and usage of the military to stamp out crime and “domestic unrest” (you may remember this is similar to what the Fed did following the Crackdown)
-A banning and proscribing of paramilitary organisations and a “return to order on the streets”
-Mandatory hard labour for prisoners to solve the food crisis
-Implementation of heavy tariffs on all nations to “protect European goods”
-Nationalisation of major corporations and money “given back to the European people”

As you can see, they ran on a hard-right platform with vague economically leftist notions that many knew would not be followed through. The actions of many NEF politicians, however, showed to be far more extreme than the implications of the party programme. Several minor and some major politicians were pictured doing the Hitler salute, and some openly talked about massacring protestors and banning leftist parties. The NEF was a big-tent party containing a variety of some extreme and some less extreme hard-right parties, however the extreme right soon dominated over the moderates, and at its heart the NEF was proudly neo-fascist.

The NEF also had open affiliations with many far-right extremist terrorist groups which caused havoc in 1990s Europe. The trouble they got in the courts led them to have an extreme fixation with controlling the judiciary, which was seen as the main obstacle to their success. Some people consider their extremism to be what prevented them from taking power in 1999 as many would-be voters were fearful of their terrorist connections and prideful authoritarianism. However, considering the success of outright communists in many parts of Europe (e.g. the 1995 Paris mayoral election), it is likely their extremism contributed to them performing so well.

Realistically, though, them taking power was a pipe dream. Too many voters disliked their extremism for them to gain enough votes to take power, and they only had the small EPP as a potential coalition partner. Their hard limit was likely around 35% of total votes, not enough for even a majority coalition. This scenario is incredibly implausible, however, with a few ASBs, many more violent leftist demonstrations, a worse societal collapse in the Middle East and North Africa, and a more lax European immigration policy, they could just barely come into power in the Federation and return the demonic spectres of Fascism and Nazism to the continent once more.

---

THE NEW YORK TIMES
Wednesday, April 14th, 1999

EXTREME RIGHT WIN SHOCK VICTORY IN EUROPEAN FEDERAL ELECTION
DEFEATED SOCIALISTS VOW TO “FIGHT ON”
ULTRA-NATIONALISM RESURGENT ACROSS EUROPE ONCE MORE

---

On April 14, 1999, the results come in, and are a shock to everyone. The National European Front won a plurality of seats with roughly 41% of the popular vote, the PES coming in second place with 22% and the communists with 18%. The conservative EPP’s vote share cratered, falling to a meagre 11%. They were soon approached by the NEF to form a coalition government. It took only a few days for negotiations to conclude, due to intimidation of the party by fascist paramilitaries, the radical shifting of the EPP to the right over the campaign [1], and a belief by some that they would be able to moderate them. This would prove to only be somewhat correct. On the other side, reactions were mixed. The PES were despairful at the result, not knowing how the predictions were so wrong and fearful they would be suppressed and banned. The ECL were also fearful, but pleased at their good results and optimistic the unions and paramilitaries would bring the government down soon enough. Both parties refused to cooperate to stop the fascist menace, and it seemed a scene reminiscent of 1933 Germany was playing out, with little to stop it. Radical changes would be made over the coming years.

“The refugees are a bane to our society” - immigration and deportation policy under the NEF

The first major piece of legislation that the new government passed was the Illegal Migration and Mass Deportation Act, a law which suspended immigration into the Federation and treated migrant boats as threats, allowing and encouraging the European Navy and Coast Guard to shoot down the boats. It also created provisions and gave the police powers to arrest and deport “illegal immigrants”, the specifics of that made unclear.

The act soon ran into many problems, the majority being caused by the government simply not having the money to conduct all of this. Successive federal budgets passed by the NEF increased funding for law enforcement, immigration agencies and the military (the budgets will be discussed later), but even with that, the cost of mass deportations and shooting the boats was simply too much. The navy continuously lacked funding, and operating the ships required large amounts of fossil fuels, which the Federation had been struggling to find since the summer of 1988. Only a few ships were deployed at any given time, and refugee boats easily slipped through them to the mainland. Even despite hearing of the new government, refugees still decided it was worth trying to reach Europe to escape the hell their homeland had become. Once reaching the Federation, they were often able to slip into the underworld of many major cities and become practically undetectable, often working in illegal occupations or essentially as slaves to the vast criminal gangs. Legal immigration was already close to nonexistent, and so the total ban had little effect. Illegal immigration did show a marked decrease, but still occurred on a large scale. [2]

The mass deportations policy was also, unsurprisingly, unworkable. The police remained incredibly underfunded, and detecting who was illegal proved to be immensely difficult. Quotas were set by the government for the amount to be arrested by a regional department every day, and to meet them the police began ignoring legality and arrested anyone who was non-white and looked suspicious to them, even if they were there legally. The detaining in November 1999 of a legal immigrant who heavily contributed to the local community and ran a food bank in Paris sparked weeks of brutal race riots, which often ended up incredibly bloody as paramilitaries stepped in. (The unrest again will be covered later) The police already had their hands full, and so the government created a whole new branch named the IEB (Immigration Enforcement Bureau) whose job was to conduct deportations and find illegal immigrants faster than the police due to having certain protections from the law, however the government struggled to find extra funds for them, and they performed dismally as a department. The IEB also suffered from many court challenges as a result, some successful, further fuelling the government’s hatred of them. Another major issue was how the deportations would be conducted. Almost everyone deported or targeted for deportation came from the Middle East or North Africa, and the only way to get there was via boat travel. However, the Federation had few usable boats that weren’t reserved for trade and the military. The military did assist, but running the ships cost fuel, and the Federation had little of that. The government did consider seizing the private boats of people including fishermen, however, when considering the massive backlash it would face from their base, they decided against it, and deportations took place at a frustratingly slow pace.

As the immigration agenda of the government quickly fell to pieces, they knew they had to act decisively and quickly. Immigration was easily the biggest issue of their supporters and despite their draconian nature had lots of support among the European populace. In late 2000, after dismal migration statistics, the immigration minister was replaced with a much more hardline figure and the government decided on two key measures to solve the issue. One was to use the paramilitaries to conduct seizures of immigrants quicker (they had already been integrated into the police force weeks ago), and the other was to do away with the failed policy of deportation entirely, and instead put them to work for the country, creating the Federation’s first concentration camps.

The paramilitaries acted with incredible brutality in immigrant raids, driven by their vision of many of them as inhuman following years of relentless propaganda and indoctrination. Oftentimes, many would die in these raids, and most underwent horrific beatings, creating many court challenges of their own. Leftist paramilitaries stepped up their efforts to stop the raids, intervening several times and successfully saving many. The concentration camps were truly dreadful places, especially at their inception. Detainees would do many hours of strenuous work every day for no pay, being practically worked to death in unhygienic conditions with very little food or water. The conditions were quickly publicised, and were met with colossal backlash, even from the NEF’s base, many of whom didn’t want any immigrants working at all in the country. This occurred despite the NEF repeatedly and baselessly claiming conditions were well in them, and they were doing hard work for the country. Faced with imminent revolt from the EPP and the possible collapse of the government, they backtracked, and promised to improve conditions in the camps as soon as possible. However, the backlash remained, and many camps would soon end up closing due to political pressure and financial difficulties, their inhabitants simply sent to prisons. The status quo continued until the Red Summer, with there being no other real options for the NEF to do - if they moderated they would lose their base, if they radicalised they would lose their coalition. The immigration policy of the NEF had catastrophically failed, with targets hardly being met and resistance against them higher than ever before.

“Anti-sovereignty, anti-nationalism, anti-European, that is the state of this traitorous judiciary” - the fight against and rigging of Europe’s courts by the NEF

Europe’s judiciary had been the cause of many headaches and setbacks for the NEF since their founding. Their paramilitaries and their brutality had given them many negative run-ins with the law and policies in their state governments had been overturned by them before, for instance Italy’s deportation law in 1999, helping galvanise the NEF’s voters and bringing them a majority in the federal government. Now, their eyes were set upon it, ready to destroy their neutrality once and for all.

“The media is such a godlike tool to be wielded” - the collapse of press freedom under the NEF

“They are not human, just scum of the Earth” - the suppression of the left and (attempted) of crime by the NEF

“We cannot go down like in 1933” - the shift of the PES to the left and alliance with the Communists

“We fear this government could bring an immeasurable collapse of order” - the NEF’s relations with FulTec and the foodstuffs industry


[1] In the original scenario they only somewhat did that, and following the failure returned to the centre-right in collaboration with the liberal ALDE.
[2] In the original scenario the ban on refugees does cause a slight drop in illegal migration, however this is temporary, and the numbers remain high.

Part 4: The Living Death (credits to whoever on main thread mentioned that) (2024-27+solar storm)

The Antarctica Conference (at start). The purpose of the Antarctic Conference was that the ruling elites of the remaining nations had realized that at this rate, the world would no longer become habitable, for everyone, by 2040. Unless a huge amount of people were to suddenly die, there was no hope for anyone. The nations talk about various ways that they could reform lifestyles or delay the 2040 deadline, but all of them would require incomprehensible amounts of resources to effectively pull off - resources that nobody had at this point. Even a mass euthanasia project would be infeasible due to damage to global wind currents. The countries ultimately decide on slowly moving important citizens (scientists, engineers, wealthy people) to cooler places, and gradually phase out their government before leaving 90% of the population to starve.

Population extermination squads? 
Population extermination squads are told whatever they need to hear to get the job done: that their targets are subversives, rebels, communists/capitalists, jews, arabs, and some are even told the truth that there are too many mouths to feed and not enough food to go around. What none of them are told is that they are entirely, 100% expendable and the governments have no plans to extract them. They are meant to buy time for the actual special forces to acquire seeds, animal samples and technical materials. All of them die from the Chinese Bioweapon and/or the nukes. This is also the reason for the US Military’s Rebellion right at the end of the Great Death - a high ranking armchair general who served in Vietnam refuses to have his soldiers killed, and tells them the truth about the goal of the extermination squads. However, by this point, the exterminations are 95% complete.

2100-2110: The new societies start to forget their past sins and become more hedonistic, however they can never get too lazy as the amount of minerals left and the small amount of arable land keeps humanity very small (probably 1 million at most)

Epilogue: The Black Ages (3000AD)
The world in 3000 AD - new date system is years after GD (e.g. 3000 is roughly 1000 in new calendar). Summary on what things are like. World is in medieval state, there are a lot less people due to there being less food. Technological development would be stunted due to heavy resource extraction. They would likely never get to the industrial revolution on a large scale as most fossil fuels are extracted out. Probably a good thing.

Glorious Decades (pre-1988)
December 8, 1941 - Ivan Voronin is born
July 28, 1953 - South Korea places tariffs on Japan
May 29, 1954 - Richard Shelby Holden is born
October 7, 1958 - Prince Moulay Hassan of Morocco is killed when his plane is shot down during the 1958 Rif Riots
November 8, 1960 [POINT OF DIVERGENCE]: Pharmacologist Frances Oldham Kelsey, a reviewer of new drug applications for the US Food and Drug Administration, is severely injured in a car accident. Although she eventually recovers after a couple of months, it is too late for her to stop the approval of thalidomide in the United States in December 1960.
February 26, 1961 - Prince Moulay Abdullah becomes king of Morocco
March 1961: Having received FDA approval the previous year, thalidomide hits the US market.
April 4, 1961 - Abdullah I makes Morocco a constitutional monarchy based off the UK
July 21, 1961: Gus Grissom travels into space. The mission goes perfectly, and the hatch of the Liberty Bell does not open during splashdown.
November 1961: Thalidomide is pulled from distribution after it is linked to birth defects.
May 9, 1962: Submitted after a series of delays, the oral contraceptive pill fails to gain FDA approval in the wake of the thalidomide scandal.
June 1963 - Syria begins allying with the USA
Early 1964: RCA buys the patents for an optical disc recording technology developed by David Paul Gregg and James Russell. Further work begins in collaboration with Philips.
February 26, 1964: American astronaut John Glenn dies at the age of 42 after hitting his head against a bathtub.
December 3, 1964 - Trade unions are outlawed in South Korea
March 1965 - The March Uprising succeeds, starting the Bahraini Civil War
June 19, 1965 - Houari Boumédiène decides to not stage his coup
January 27, 1967: The Apollo One fire occurs. Astronauts Grissom, White and Chaffee are injured, but survive.
March 31, 1967 - Construction on the future capital of the UAE begins 
July 23rd, 1967 - Holden Terminals is founded
October 1967 - The Moroccan Phosphate Boom starts
October 10, 1967 - The Popular Front, a Maoist militia group in the Bahraini Civil War, is formed
April 29, 1968 - Lockheed and Douglas merge
August 3, 1968 - The Blood Tide Massacre, a US-perpetrated War Crime, occurs in Cambodia
January 22, 1969 - Leonid Brehznev is assassinated
March 2, 1969 - President Nixon authorizes the sale of $5 million USD worth of weapons to the NUC in the Bahraini Civil War
March 28, 1969 - Following Nixon’s lead, the UK donates WW1 rifles to the NUC
May, 1969 - Syria holds its first elections 
June 1, 1969 - A truce is signed by the NUC and Arab Nationalists 
June 8, 1969 - To prevent a cult of personality like Mao or Stalin, the Soviet Union adopts the Triumvirate System
June 9, 1969 - Anton Agassi becomes General Secretary of the USSR
June 29, 1969 - The last Bahraini holdout is wiped out
1969 - 1970 - The Soviet Union reorganizes their economy, government and industry
July 19, 1969: Senator Ted Kennedy and Mary Jo Kopechne are both killed in a car accident at Chappaquiddick.
July 20, 1969: Gus Grissom is the first man to land on the Moon. The Bahraini Civil War is officially ended
August 1969 - The USA sends troops to Lebanon
September 1969 - North Yemen stops receiving aid from other nations
1970 - CO2 concentration is at avg. 324ppm. Hippie counter culture is wiped out by the combined efforts of Richard Nixon and J. Edgar Hoover. The average age of members of the Politburo is reduced to 49
January 1970 - The USA sends even more troops to Lebanon
February 1970 - The last PLO members in Lebanon are pacified
August 19, 1970 - The first elections in Bahrain are held
August 24, 1970 - Hassan al-Mutairi wins the first elections in Bahrain
September 30, 1970: After 6 years of collaboration, RCA and Philips release the LaserDisc - an optical disc format for home video for consumers and data storage for computers. Variants at launch include LD-A/V (home video), LD-ROM (data storage), and LD-WORM (write once, read many). While it plays second fiddle to MagTape in the home video market - it absolutely dominates the home computer market for data storage in the future Glorious Decades.
October 10, 1970 - The People’s Party of Bahrain is formed
January 1, 1971 - Agassi dedicates this year to modernizing the USSR. This would mean that the USSR supports leftists movements less and stops being so involved in Vietnam
February 10, 1971 - As a result of Agassi’s policies, a minor revolt occurs in the Turkish SSRs but are all crushed by the summer
June 1971 - The Main Task is far more successful in East Germany
July 14, 1971 - Relations between West Germany and the USSR begin to warm up
September 11, 1971 - Chairman Mao is successfully assassinated by Chen Qiang
October 5, 1971 - An escaped high-ranking Chinese official tells the Politburo how Chen Qiang plans to betray the working class of China
October 12, 1971-January 1, 1975 - The Soviet Union creates the “Monsoon Protocol”, helping educated Chinese communists escape from Chen’s China
Winter 1971 - Border skirmishes along the China-USSR border lead to over 2000 casualties
January 23, 1972 - The KGB deduces that an agent of the PRC assassinated Brezhnev. This would cause the second Sino-Soviet Split, and both nations would enter a hostile relationship until a brief detente in the mid 80s. 
February 22, 1972 - Khalifa bin Hamad Al Thani’s coup fails
February 28, 1972 - After months of negotiation, Shanghai Accords are finally signed by the U.S. and China, changing the world and the timeline forever
March, 1972 - Nixon begins pressuring Assad to hold more free elections
March 1, 1972 - Tunisia severs ties with China
March 15, 1972 - the Boeing 2707 is unveiled for the first time
April 1972 - The USSR and China both try to gain influence in Somalia
April 13, 1972: President Nixon is injured in an assassination attempt during a state visit to Canada. The gunman, later identified as Arthur Herman Bremer, is arrested at the scene. While Herman is not associated with any radical political groups, the FBI, under Hoover's direction, nonetheless uses the incident as an excuse to further clamp down on dissidents.
April 16, 1972 - The USSR, with the help of Chinese exiles, begins widespread industrial programs and public works programs. New factories are built to covertly manufacture weapons for a war with China
June 1972: Building off the successful LaserDisc format - RCA and Philips release the videocassette format MagTape to consumers. It has the ability to record television programs at a set time, record home movies, and playback pre-recorded tapes with films on it. Thanks to the economic prosperity brought about by the Shanghai Accords - MagTape is a runaway commercial success that quickly redefines how people watch television and movies.
July 28, 1972 - The first People’s University is opened in Moscow, allowing farmers to learn an education and creating a massive service industry
September 3, 1972 - Lake Baikal is drained for irrigation 
October 8th, 1972 - The Tehran Accords (1972) - signed after the Shanghai Accords earlier in the same year - this was a peace treaty between the United States, Egypt, Israel and Iran. It basically involved the Arab world monopolizing the oil industry, with guarantees that other producers cannot undercut them. In exchange, Israel got to keep the Sinai. To guarantee Israel’s safety - American unconditional funding into Israel would go into overdrive (OTL’s post-Cold War levels) while an unconditional security agreement would be penned with the State of Israel and the Imperial State of Iran - guaranteeing both would respond if either was attacked. Bahrain is also recognized as independent by Iran. The members of the PLO are forced to leave Syria, Lebanon, Jordan and Iran, settling in Iraq and Egypt. 
November 7, 1972 - Richard Nixon wins the presidential election in a colossal landslide winning all states but D.C. Republicans make major gains in Congress.
November 9, 1972 - The first Worker’s Palace is started outside Riga, Latvian SSR
December 31, 1972 - The United Arab Emirates becomes the richest Arab nation at the time
February 6, 1973 - The Zakat Party proposes turning Morocco into a welfare state
February 12, 1973 - Hoxha is assassinated and his successor is very close to Chairman Chen. 
March 18, 1973 - The Competitive Building Act is passed, making it so that buildings made after 1970 cannot legally be maintained/restored beyond human safety concerns, unless they are a notable historical building (and it’s honestly quite easy to get a building on this list). This is meant to help facilitate competition and cause more buildings to be built
March 20, 1973 - Romania opens talks with China
Spring 1973 - The Democracy movement in Thailand succeeds

Following the strike, Israel launches nuclear weapons at Saudi and Iraqi oil fields and cities. Minister Petrov resigns from the Triumvirate. Damascus is destroyed by Iran and Israel. 
June 9, 1988 - Iraq launches all its remaining nukes at sites and cities in Israel and Iran. Billions of barrels of oil are set up in flame, and with major capitals destroyed, central governments collapse overnight across the Middle East.
As day breaks, panic sets in and panic buying occurs across the west. Markets fall by double digits as people anticipate massive inflation shocks.
Following days - Economies sharply contract, inflation surges, rioting begins

Red Decade (1988-2000)
Summer 1988 - Almost a third of land in the USSR is tainted with pollution

Famines begin across the world. From 1990 onwards, the temperature anomaly passes 1.5°C and never returns. Minor famines hit North America as well. Farms in South Yemen go under, never to be reopened

The Austere Decade (2000-2010)

The Years of Salt and Lead (2010-2020)

2010 - Global temp. anomaly passes 4°C. Africa’s population is 2.1 billion. By this time, all cargo ships, and most naval ships, have been disassembled for parts. Qatar is considered cursed. Most of Australia’s 30 million inhabitants are crowded into 10 cities around its eastern coast

April 4, 2014 - The entire PLA navy fleet is sunk off the coast of Sydney, Australia

May 2014 - Research by the Red Army into using plant diseases as biological weapons leads the KGB to conclude that China is recycling their dead for food
May 22, 2014 - The Food, Inc Convoy arrives in India
June 2, 2014 - In an emergency, top secret meeting between Jarret’s Cabinet and the Board of Food, Inc, an agreement is reached to test out using human flesh as filler
June 10, 2014 - The Food, Inc tests out Ration Omega on unsuspecting Indian Survivors in exchange for precious metals in the ruins of India
July 9, 2014 - Last reported case of a rat outside of a city in the USA
November 2014 - As a result of the Midterms a vast amount of politicians in the Northeast turn Green
November 27, 2014 - East Germany annexes Czechia
December 1, 2014 - Citing “increased terrorist activity”, all remaining public rail lines, buses and boats in the Federation are closed
December 4, 2014 - The Pilgrims are formed after a meeting in Boston, Massachusetts

December 2014 - The Soviet military swells to 45 million active service members
January 1, 2015 - China’s net population has decreased for the first time ever
January 9, 2015 - Poland finishes their border wall to the south of Hungary
January 15, 2015 - Food, Inc begins researching more cost-effective methods of collecting algae for foodstuffs

February 18, 2015 - Voronin dies of cancer at age 74
February 26, 2015 - Ration Gamma, an algae and seaweed based foodstuff, begins to be sold in the US
March 1, 2015 - Savateev becomes dictator of the Soviet Union
Spring 2015 - FulTec and Food, Inc are using insects as filler. Algae-based food is tested, but expensive
April, 2015 - Last major accessible deposits of natural gas are exhausted
Summers 2015 and 16 - The Great Heatwaves occur as a result of “Hyper El Ninos” - the last of the world’s major vegetation shrivels up and dies, including around the Great Lakes. Food, Inc around this time decides that cannibalism is the only viable option - whether it actually was is unknown. Global temp. anomaly passes 5°C
June 10, 2015 - The last federal emergency reserves of the Universal Food Ration are exhausted
July 11, 2015 - In an emergency top secret session of Congress, Project Omega is authorized. Most are told that it is simply recycling human corpses as fertilizer, and is only a temporary measure
August, 2015 - Due to coal unions, coal becomes the dominant energy source in Europe and the UK
August 30, 2015 - Food, Inc releases their new product, Ration Omega, to the USA
October 1, 2015 - The Jarret Administration declares Hawai’i unsustainable, mainly as a way to remove the Green Party stronghold there
October 15, 2015 - Due to the heatwave continuing, Project Omega is temporarily extended to the end of 2016
November 2015 - FulTec begins to mass-produce Plenty to avoid a food crisis when temperatures surge again the following year as projected. As Natural becomes too unviable to create Plenty quickly replaces it
December 2015 - The Universal Food Ration, supplemented by Ration Omega, is slowly reimplemented

June 5, 2016 - The USSR implements the “Worker’s Lottery”. Civil unrest dies down

July 17, 2016 - A fleet carrying millions of Algerian refugees are sunk by the Federation Navy

October 30, 2016 - The Survivor’s Council of Kuwait City is formed

November 8, 2016 - Jarret is re-elected after Food, Inc dumps billions of dollars into his campaign. 
Due to resource shortages, the elections in the Northeast and Rust Belt are rigged. This is the first election where the Republicans win no electoral votes
January 20, 2017 - President Jarret uses Executive Orders to cut more services. The Department of Welfare is reduced to only the Universal Food Ration, the National Relief was abolished, and National Monuments began to be sold off to collectors
February 2017 - Tunisian city-states start to join the Constantine Confederacy
March 13, 2017 - A secret report by NASA, using the few satellites still in orbit, predicts that 97% of the surface of the Earth would become uninhabitable by 2070. As a result, Project Omega is extended indefinitely 
March 16, 2017 - President Jarret dismantles NASA and sells their equipment to various corporations
April 5, 2017 - With no more fuel, President Jarret sells off the US Air Force

President Sanderson speaks to David Sturges, the last Commissioner of the FDA, attempts to share evidence of Operation: Eagle’s Nest and the 2017 NASA report but is killed before President Sanderson can learn the full details

Great Death (2027-2035)

June 16, 2027 - The remaining elites gather the seed and embryo samples they could obtain and head into bunkers. The USA goes to Alaska and Hawaii, Australia and New Zealand go to Tasmania, the Nordic Union go to Svalbard, the USSR go to Yuzhny Island, the European Federation go to Iceland while the remaining world powers (Argentina, Poland, East Germany and Japan) colonize Antarctica 
June 27, 2027 - 43rd US President Peter S. Jarret is killed in a mutiny by US Marines on the way to Juneau, Alaska
January 9, 2028 - Dean Williamson, the 46th and last President of the United States, dies of radiation poisoning outside of Duluth, Minnesota
October 2028: The Pacific “Hypercane” forms, destroying many settlements that survived EoH in Oceania
2028-2035 - Unprecedented famine sweeps the world, killing almost everyone who survived Project Eyes of Heaven and nuclear war
