Access to clean water is also an issue persisting throughout the Glorious Decades due to pollution of rivers
Sanitation issues cause a huge cholera outbreak in 1987
When the Crash of 1988 hits, access to clean water and additional energy plummets
This finally flares up into a civil war in 1989, with South Africa invading to “maintain the peace” between white minorities and African nationalists 
Many that fled to South Africa in the 1970s and 1980s return to help run this new government
In the Hot Summer of 1990, “New Rhodesia” blames their economic problems on the blacks and institute apartheid
“New Rhodesia” Official becomes a part of South Africa in 1991
In the 1990s, plantations and summer houses are set up for the white minority while the africans are strictly segregated 
Some minor rebellions happen in the late 1990s, but nothing on the scale of Botswana
Clean water is prioritized for the whites while polluted water is used for irrigating food for the “lesser races” 
But by 2003, this becomes unfeasible, and instead water starts to become prioritized for loyal whites and cannibalism becomes used like how it is in Botswana
Due to Rhodesia’s relatively habitable climate, major farms are established here using water from Mozambique 
The summer of 2011 forces the GAR to rethink land allocation, and begins scaling back their mining efforts in Rhodesia to instead use it for farming
Between 2011 and 2014, Rhodesia is the main summer home for the white elites
During the Great Heat Waves, pipelines from Mozambique are damaged by rebels and this launches the South African Water Wars
From 2015-2018, the GAR engages in a campaign of ruthless genocide in Zambia, Malawi and Mozambique, with many soldiers coming from Rhodesia
The status quo continues until 2023, when several white outposts in Angola and Namibia demand more water, almost causing a civil war. This forces the GAR to expand ever further into Tanzania and into the sphere of the Ethiopian Confederacy 
During the solar flare of 2026, many of the farms catch on fire, and for the first time the Groot Leader is forced to reduce rations for the white minority 
As of 2027, Rhodesia is barely hanging on, as fears of civil war has led to the gradual demilitarization of Rhodesia
Mozambique (Population: 45,101,577, circa 2020)
Mozambique becomes independent in 1973 due to mediations by the USA and China
They sign the Shanghai Accords in 1973
The Portuguese were granted safe passage to Portugal, becoming an extremely small minority by 1973
China helps guide Mozambique into a beacon of “African Socialism”, with a one-party authoritarian dictatorship ruling in “the name of the people and workers” 
The government remains quite authoritarian during the Glorious Decades, however they open up trade with the outside world much like China
Businesses were nationalized and then sold out to foreign investors, and the media was state controlled
In the 1970s, Machel was quite paranoid about pop culture infiltrating Mozambique and thus heavily policed against “western cultural imperialism” until mellowing out in the 1980s
Mozambique created a “party loyalty sliding scale”, which judged citizens based on how loyal they were to Machel. If they were deemed deviants, they were sent to concentration camps (in the 1970s) and work factories (in the 1980s) 
Martial law is declared in 1979, with a low-intensity civil war between Machel’s communist faction and anti-communist rebels. South Africa is accused of supplying the rebels but denies any involvement. 
In 1981, China intervenes and helps Machel wipe out the insurgents, in exchange for a tighter control of their economy 
Mozambique gradually became a satellite state of China, with Machel being deposed in 1983 and a pro-Chen member taking his place
An oil industry is established in the late 1980s
After the Crash of 1988, there is a brief oil boom until 1990 when rebels pick up again. The lack of help from China causes their puppet government to fall and a distinctly soviet-style government takes its place 
This soviet-backed government is led by a man referred to as “The Stalin of Africa”. He uses extreme repression, genocide and deliberate famines to control the population
This new government only lasts until 1998, when South African forces instigate a civil war and take it over in 1999 
Throughout the 2000s, South Africa engages in extensive mining and natural gas extraction operations throughout Mozambique, while also setting up pipelines to direct water towards Rhodesia and South Africa
In 2004, the South Africans implement the “stew” system 
Between 2005-2018, numerous guerrilla groups launch uprisings against the GAR, finally culminating in the bombing of a pipeline in 2015 and a ruthless campaign of genocide 
Mozambique is kept on a very tight leash, with white officers usually going there to “take out their frustrations” on the locals 
In the 2020s, “safaris” are organized, where GAR officers comb the countryside to wipe out guerrillas for sport 
The Great Heatwave of 2023 cause disputes between white farm owners on how to allocate the water, with the Groot Leader forced to step in
In 2025 the GAR starts campaigns of ethnic cleansing against the natives to free up more resources for the whites, and also establishes heavily fortified military bases along the pipelines 
The 2026 solar storm causes a communication breakdown and several Xhosa guerillas launch a short-lived uprising
By 2027 most of Mozambique is abandoned, as the GAR no longer has the equipment or energy to access the minerals in the mountains 
Malawi (Population: 31,845,373, circa 2020)
Malawi becomes a totalitarian dictatorship like in OTL 
Because Malawi has little to no natural resources, many countries turn a blind eye. Morgan does not try to pressure them to become democratic 
In the 1980s, Malawi signs the Shanghai Accords of their volition but nothing ever comes of it
In the mid 1980s, Malawi tries to create a service industry and work as call centers for western countries but it doesnt pan out
After the crash of 1988, basically nothing changes, everyone in Malawi is still dirt poor and the leader is able to maintain a hold on his power 
A civil war happens in the aftermath of the Hot Summer of 1990 as some of Banda’s men believe they aren’t getting enough so they kill him in 1991 
In the 1990s, the civil war continues and eventually becomes warlords fighting each other for slaves and water
In 1998, South Africa rolls in to create “stability” but it’s really to gather water
Between 1998 and 2003, pipelines are built to send water from Malawi through Mozambique to South Africa and Rhodesia
Some of Banda’s men remained relatively okay with South Africa so the Boers find one and prop him up as the puppet leader to basically be totalitarian for them
However in 2011 they kill him and install a white leader there
Malawi isn’t hit that hard by the Great Heatwaves of 2015 and 2016, and in fact, the GAR has to send a bit of extra food there to keep the white soldiers satisfied
The Water Wars of 2015-2018 lead to many, many Malawi being killed, with a large genocide thouroughly depopulating the region 
In the 2020s, the GAR begins expanding out of Malawi into Tanzania
During the Second Great Heatwave of 2023 and 2024, Malawi actually is hit by drought 
In 2025, the GAR enacts cleansing campaigns like in Mozambique 
The 2026 solar flare does not damage any technology or cause any fires in Malawi, but it does cause the GAR to lose a major battle in Tanzania and retreat to Malawi
By 2027, Malawi is essentially a giant fortified water treatment plant used by the GAR
Zambia (Population: 20,704,534, circa 2020)
After 1973, China and the US pressures them to open up their mines for foreign investment
Kaunda finally relents in 1974, and opens up the country to foreign investment
This causes the government to gradually lose control on a lot of things like the Soviet Union did in the 1980s OTL
In 1978, Kaunda steps down and flees to the USSR
Elections are held in 1980 and 1984
Zambia becomes an industrialized capitalist democracy in the 1980s, focusing on the mining and export of copper 
Zambia becomes very close with China and even hosts a SIZ
This causes environmental issues in the mid 1980s and Zambia is forced to import food to feed its population 
After the crash of 1988, the military takes over and essentially controls only the mines, with the rural areas left to fend for themselves 
The military sells ore and metal to whoever will buy it, mainly Zaire, Tanzania and South Africa
In the 1990s, Zaire takes over parts of northern Zambia 
The military, using China’s old equipment, then engages in a war to take back northern territory from Zaire
This is when South Africa orchestrates a civil war between the military warlords, causing them to mostly wipe each other out. 
In 1996, South Africa annexes Zambia 
In the late 1990s, South Africa dismantles the factories and SIZ in Zambia to prevent a further uprising
In the 2000s, South Africa engages in extensive mining operations in Zambia. However, they are not that cautious about the environment this time, and use this dirty water for their slaves
During the summer of 2011, millions die from dehydration or water-borne diseases. The stew system is implemented around this time
Between 2011-2014, rebel groups begin to form, including escaped Xhosa
Between 2015-2018 Zambia is the site of a genocidal campaign by the GAR
Around 2019 the GAR runs out of energy to effectively extract the minerals from Zambia, so they turn it into a series of plantations
Between 2019 and 2023, Zambia sufferers from chronic droughts before the Great Heat Wave of 2023 and 2024 causes all the remaining farms to die up 
The GAR blames the blacks and starts engaging in operations to kill them en masse
However, rebels from the Congo and Tanzania come to their aid, leading to northern Zambia to be one of the “Dark Frontiers” and a major theater of the Ethiopian-GAR Water War
Between 2024-2026, the GAR starts making gains and actually reaching the Lualaba River
However, the solar storm of 2026 forces the GAR to retreat towards Zambia, where they create fortifications
By 2027, Zambia is facing daily incursions by the Ethiopians
Angola (Population: 47,281,072, circa 2020)
Angola was freed around the same time as Mozambique 
The civil war is resolved in a unique situation, however - the three main factions: The FNLA, the UNITA and the MPLA are all given an equal third of the country, which is ruled as a confederacy 
This goes about as well as you would expect it would, and by 1979, the civil war picks up again, with China and the United States supporting UNITA
By 1981, the civil war had died down mostly, with the UN working on creating an intergovernmental mandate to help police Angola (and keep it open to resources)
However, throughout the 1980s, guerilla warfare continues and Angola remains dangerous and poor. 
Frequent guerilla attacks make it impractical to extract resources
In 1988, after the crash, the UN leaves and the civil war picks up again, this time with support from the USSR
In 1989, the MPLA establishes their control and creates a soviet-style republic
Between 1989 and 1993, there are rumors that the Soviets are siphoning Angolan oil back to the motherland 
The Soviet Union helps establish farms and irrigation in Angola, which due to its large amount of fertile land, actually doesn't see any famines in the 1990s (as many people died from guerilla warfare) 
Flooding and storms throughout the 1990s cause internal friction and in 1994 the Soviets finally leave
Mismanagement of resources and soviet equipment cause massive amounts of land pollution and a major famine in 1997
The South-African backed remnants of UNITA and FNLA launch an uprising and civil war in 1998, with South Africa annexing them in 1999
In the 2000s, South Africa took a special interest in Angola. Flood walls were built along the coast, and pipelines were made to bring water from East Africa into Angola. Many military bases were established along the Angolan border, and White-owned businesses began to expand into Angola
China tries to help “modernize” Angola but the South Africans refuse
The Hot Summer of 2003 causes South Africa to begin building border walls along Angola’s border with Zaire and the Congo
Angola actually remains relatively well fed, as the majority of the food stuff for the whites comes from Angola (though the Groot Leader’s food is grown directly in South Africa) 
South Africa splits their operations equally between mining and farming, until 2011, when they prioritize it solely for farming and enact the stew policy 
Throughout the 2010s, Angola requires more and more water for their farming operations, eventually forcing the Water War of 2015-2018 to maintain their agriculture 
As agriculture gradually becomes less feasible, the GAR instead shifts to mining projects in the 2020s
The Great Heat Waves of 2023 and 2024 cause immense drought and millions to die of dehydration before extreme floods and storms devastate the region in 2025
The Solar Storm of 2026 causes the borders to become defenseless and various warlords try to invade, though many of them die in the heat
As of 2027, Angola has the last functional farms in the GAR outside of South Africa
Lesotho (Population: 1,295,876, circa 2020)
Lesotho doesn't have that many natural resources, so the remain relatively unchanged by the Shanghai Accords
Leabua Jonathan remains in power in an autocracy supported by South Africa all the way until 1990, where during the Hot Summer, South Africa annexes them for their water
Throughout the 1990s, as South Africa transitions to becoming the Totalitarian GAR, Lesotho essentially becomes a White-Only enclave 
By 2003, Lesotho is completely depopulated of natives and turned into a walled city for the Groot Leader and his close allies
In 2004, all the remaining “coloreds” are turned into servants employed in the vast estates in Lesotho 
Between 2004 and 2024, Lesotho remains a relatively calm place, isolated from the outside world, though a few assassins do get in and have failed attempts on the Groot Leader, taking place in 2010, 2014, 2022 and 2026
By 2022, Lesotho is the only place where natural food can be bought in the GAR (as by this point, all the “natural” food left over is processed into Food, Inc-style rations
The Solar Storm of 2026 causes a major disruption in the security systems of the Groot Leader’s Palace, with a failed coup against the Groot Leader by african-sympathetic whites 
As of 2027, Lesotho is a heavily-policed enclave, with the Groot Leader’s bunker being constructed by colored slaves 
Madagascar (Population: 42,838,153, circa 2020)
Maintained strong economic ties to France in the Glorious Decades, becoming a major tourist destination
With the help of France, the socialist revolution is crushed and Madagascar becomes a corrupt though somewhat democratic state
Living standards remained fine, but Madagascar became closely aligned with Europe
In the 1980s, the current president is very unpopular with a growing rebel movement springing up in the late 1980s
After the crash of 1988 and France pulling out support, a revolution happens and a one-party authoritarian socialist state is created, supported by the USSR
Drought and storms ravage the population throughout the 90s, but repression keeps them in check 
Pirates and crime rates are very high
China visits them in the 2000s and helps set up mining and off-shore drilling operations
China also helps defend them against pirates
In 2006, the Red Flu is spread to Madagascar through China, which later spreads to the mainland GAR in 2007
In 2007, after China leaves, the GAR invades Madagascar and turns it into a giant prison farm where they send criminals and later coloreds 
Flooding and storms continue to ravage the island, though the GAR holds on in the 2010s
In the 2020s, a colossal storm in 2023 causes over 25 million estimated deaths
Between 2024-2027 efforts to rebuild the farms are ongoing 
As of 2027, Madagascar’s farms are continually ravaged by storms and the GAR considering abandoning it
Swaziland (Population: 2,347,237, circa 1990)
History is very similar to Lesotho in the Glorious Decades, with South Africa essentially using it as a puppet state
South Africa annexes them in 1991
Swaziland is transformed into an enclave for “coloreds” loyal to the white regime 
However, by the 2000s, is it essentially a giant slum
The anti-GAR resistance movement, the Umnqophiso Wokuwa is founded here 
Frequent raids into Swaziland in the 2010s cause it essentially be turned into a prison 
In 2019, it is walled off completely and all resources in are turned off. The GAR sends white criminals to die there 
In the 2020s, Swaziland becomes essentially its own country, as the GAR leave it alone and occasionally organize purges. It is in anarchy, but there are small pockets of civilization. 
Swaziland was not impacted by the Solar Storm 
As of 2027, the resistance are organizing a full-scale uprising across the entire GAR
South Africa (Population: 74,126,015, circa 2020)
Apartheid continues as in OTL until the 1970s when it becomes extremely totalitarian 
In the 1980s, the state police assassinates many rebels and Xhosa nationalists
While South Africa does not sign the Shanghai Accords, they maintain good ties with Israel (and later East Germany) to circumvent the embargos 
The state controls the media starting in 1973
Journalists must be vetted by the government before being allowed in, and even then they can’t photograph certain things and also must be white
A group of right-wing white supremacists called the Boer Advocaten intimidate activists during the 1980s
West Germany is extremely vocal about all this, accusing South Africa of being nazis 
South Africa tries to influence politics of Botswana but fails
South Africa influences the politics of Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Angola, Lesotho, and Swaziland
South Africa barely hangs during the Glorious Decades, but because they had never invested in globalization, the Crash of 1988 doesn’t even phase them - though they do lose access to Israeli weapons 
South Africa immediately invades Namibia and formally takes it over in 1989
South Africa’s president, elected in 1989, Hendrik Coenraad Vermeulen, declares a state of emergency and gradually makes the country more and more autocratic. 
In the 1990s, South Africa’s main problem was energy, with coal and oil being reserved for the white minority 
South Africa annexes Lesotho in 1990, Swaziland in 1991, Zambia in 1996, Botswana in 1997, Malawi in 1998, Angola and Mozambique in 1999, Comoros in 2006 and Madagascar in 2007
In the late 1990s, things have gotten so segregated that there are entire “white only” cities 
Throughout the 1990s, South Africa begins organizing vast mining projects to get coal to power the white cities in South Africa
From 1990-2015, low-intensity guerrilla warfare remains a problem for the South Africans
In 2003, the white minority government begins to see the first reduction in quality of life
In 2004, the stew plan in made and the definition of a “black person” is expanded while the definition of a “white person” is reduced 
In 2005, all “coloreds” are relocated to the Swaziland enclave, made to be slaves in the Lesotho enclave, or sent to work in Madagascar
In 2006, South Africa merges with Rhodesia and is reformed into the Groot Afrikaanse Republiek
By 2011, water becomes the largest issue, with farms in places like Namibia shutting down
2011-2014 is the “Golden Age” of the GAR, with the whites building luxury homes all around southern Africa after a majority of the natives die of dehydration in 2011
From 2015-2018, the GAR engages in a genocidal campaign in retaliation for the destruction of the Mosambiek-Malawi-pyplyn
In 2016, the GAR almost has a civil war over water allocation
From 2019-2023, the GAR gets super evil, engaging in stuff like hunting natives for sport
But after the second Great Heatwave of 2023 and 2024, even the Groot Leader knows that things are going to end soon. Water becomes the utmost priority, and the GAR launches raids into central Africa for water, starting the GAR-Ethiopian Water Wars. He also authorizes the “liquidation” of 50% of the GAR black population
From 2024-2027, black people are forced to work during the day, with “the night for the whites” 
In 2026, East Germany tells the GAR about the conference and the plan for bunkers, a bunker begins to be constructed in Lesotho
The solar storm of 2026 devastates the GAR, with a major rebellion almost toppling the government 
By 2027, the definition of “white person” is literally only those in the inner circle of Nasionale Boereparty. Ethiopia is mounting a major offensive into southern Africa, and the Groot Leader begins planning to hide in his bunker

Death spiral 
Global shipping becomes extremely slow by 2000, with it stopping completely by 2010
Planes are used only for cargo, and are still charted by 2027 but are used very sparingly 
Public transportation dries up in the USA by 2010, though it remains in a very bare-bones state in Europe and Japan. Europe shuts down their rail lines for “counter terrorism” reasons, and Japan finally shuts down theirs in 2024
Natural Gas collapses after oil, with most accessible supplies running out by 2023
Mass blackouts by 2015
Mass clothing recycling initiatives, with some rumors of clothes being made out of human hair
Pharmaceuticals stop being made around 2005, notably painkillers, anesthetics, and antibiotics
Fertilizers are no longer able to be made efficiently by 2010
Farm equipment is retrofitted to use dirty coal, but this causes increased contamination 
Cold storage becomes increasingly rare, with cities setting up “municipal freezers” to store perishable goods. Eventually there is a shift to creating non-perishable rations
Consumer goods and packaging disappear, many things like furniture are now deemed “unessential” and are burned 
Medical supplies become very hard to properly package
Due to the decrease in synthetic fibers, “patchwork” becomes a very popular style 
Lack of synthetic rubber causes many industries to break down, as they can’t make things like hoses and gaskets 
Electronics are harder to insulate, leading to them being more vulnerable to damage, more dangerous to humans, and also more energy inefficient 
Most things are made out of metal, wood and glass now, as opposed to plastic 
In the 1990s, most things become packaged in paper bags, glass bottles, or metal cans
Bioplastics explored in the 1990s

Shia
Grand Ayatollah 
In 1981, a man in Al-Qatif starts preaching a return to a more fundamental style of Islam, saying that arab oil has turned life on earth stagnant and without spiritual meaning 
In the 1980s, he drifts around the middle east gaining followers 
In 1983, he arrives in Egypt, and begins a campaign of “penance” 
This sect of Islam, itself a derivative of Twelver Shi’ism, has an interpretation about the end times and believes that the Twelfth Imam will appear in Egypt upon the banks of the Nile
The movement, called Qatifism, claims that the world will soon end and point to the rampant hedonism and environmental destruction as the signs of this 
The new leader of Egypt, in 1987, takes advantage of this and starts to play into their fantasies, becoming widely popular and using it to foster his idea of an invasion of Israel

A few though take up arms, and this leads to the Sinai War

Hinduism
In the Glorious Decades, Hinduism remains more of a philosophy than an actual religion
Some scholars even claim that earlier reports that Humanity was in the Kali Yuga are wrong, and that humanity has entered the Satya Yuga
After the Arab-Israeli war, Indian religious leaders/Politicians start preaching about adherence to Vishnu, and the idea that humans had escaped the Kali Yuga were proven false
Throughout the 90s, worshippers of Shiva start to gain prominence, and even revert to sacrificing cows 
Shiva worshippers start radicalizing, leading to the worship of shiva to be banned in 2001, and Shivan temples are destroyed by government forces
After the nuclear war, worship of Vishnu falls out of favor
Instead, Shiva and Yama (god of death) become the most worshipped gods in the indian subcontinent 
Cultists sacrifice people and animals to Shiva and Yama, hoping that doing so speed up the end of the current cosmic cycle and bring the survivors into the true Satya Yuga
By the 2010s, small isolated communities exist that still worship Vishnu, and even more have converted to Islam 
By the 2020s, the main proponents of Hinduism are violent zealots obsessed with Yama
By 2027, a few moderate Hindus exist in small isolated communities in the mountains of Nepal
Buddhism 
Buddhism is a popular religion in the Glorious Decades, with many using it only for meditation and not for achieving nirvana. 
The Middle Path is mainly forgotten, as many fall into the hedonistic lifestyle present 
After the crash, Pure Land buddhism takes off, with many people hoping to transport themselves to a new, pure land 
In the 90s, the deteriorating conditions lead to many buddhists to voluntarily sign up for dangerous humanitarian missions, with the hope of dying 
An entire section of the Chinese army is composed of Buddhists hoping to be reincarnated 
In 2002, a survivor of the Indian-Pakistani war proclaims himself the Maitreya, and as he dies of radiation poisoning, he writes what he calls “the fourth path”, a way of escaping Samsara, but not becoming a buddha. It involves having a “last night worth living”, with sex, drugs, and other worldly pleasures, before dying of poison. Everyone at the last night, except one, will kill themselves. The one person who survives is a monk who assures that everyone dies with no suffering, and then the monk/watcher goes on to organize another last night where he is the only who passes. 
By 2010 though, much of Buddhism has died out, with the survivors being “the Last Gurus”, who are incredibly jaded people who forgo the rites of the Last Night and just straight up kill people, though they do try to minimize their suffering. 
By 2020, much of what exists of Buddhism is just fanatical raiders forcibly reincarnating people 
By 2027, the last remnants of Buddhism are ironically in China, who have latched on to the hope of being reincarnated

Guide on how to “research” weapons: 

So a lot of the technology is stuck in the late 1970s for the west (so 1976-1979), early 1980s for the USSR (1980-1983), late 1960s for China (1966-1969), Early 1990s for Canada, Australia and New Zealand (1990-1993), and mid 1970s everywhere else (1974-1976)

Look at the military equipment for that time, change a few numbers (the number is usually the date it was made) then for the name, many vehicles/equipment are named after famous generals/warriors/leaders. 

For example:
Looking up what tank China used in the 1960s OTL: Norinco Type 62 
Change the name to a military commander in a war China fought in the 1960s (Sino-Vietnamese War): Norinco > Zhifu
Change the number to the year it was “refurbished”: Type 62 > Type 89x

Section 1 - Golden Years (1972-1989)
The economy, culture, politics of the United Kingdom in the Glorious Decades from 1972-1989 when Labour wins power 
-UK does not have economic crisis in 1970s, leading to Edward Heath winning re-election in 1974
-Economy is stagnating compared to others, Heath resigns and is replaced by Thatcherist figure, who calls snap election and wins in 1977
-Mass deregulation, privatisation occurs. Manufacturing collapses and the north is left abandoned, deepening north-south divide, basically Thatcher pro max
-NHS is partially privatised in 1986 and 87
-Further elections won in 1979, 1984, Conservative dominance
-Crash of 88 occurs, mass protests and rioting against austerity and NHS privatisation as horror stories get out
-Conservatives voted out in landslide, reduced to third place and replaced by Liberals, Labour win massive majority
-New Labour PM is economically left-wing, NATO- and Eurosceptic, socially moderate, similar to early 80s Labour 

Section 2 - Britannia Fallen (90s and 00s)
The United Kingdom, and by extension Ireland during the 1990s and 2000s. Includes conflict with the Federation, such as the 1997 Channel Crisis, the Red Summer of 2003 and its aftermath, and the trade war and blockade with the European Federation
-Labour reverses lots of what Conservatives did when in office, mainly privatisations. Deficit skyrockets however and they cannot fully fulfil their campaign promises, mainly on budget cuts
-Rationing introduced following 1990 Hot Summer
-Fiscal crisis occurs in 1991, the government was forced to make large budget cuts. Draw large protests but many grudgingly accept it
-As a member of the EU, the UK is a participant of the Brussels Conference, but Eurosceptic government rejects joining it
-Riots in Essex and other right-wing areas in 1993 take place over poverty and immigration. Many immigrants have been coming in since 1988, used to fill gaps in employment, and they have started to be used as a scapegoat by Far-right. BNP does well in local elections that year
-1994 election - Labour loses moderate amount of support but divided opposition mean they only lose a few seats
-Decline increases in 95 and 96 and unrest gets larger and larger. Labour cracks down on beginning rioting but this creates more backlash
-1997 Channel Crisis - 
-Disastrous flooding strikes London in 1999, Thames Barrier almost collapses. Upgrades are urgently built but everyone knows London will soon collapse

Section 3 - Years of Decay (10s and 20s)
The United Kingdom and to a lesser extent Ireland during the 2010s and 2020s. Includes the connection to it with the Federation, the 2014 Agreement (that basically makes it a puppet), and the 2024 British Revolution and following British Civil War

So, this is my take (Toggy “ThatOneGuy1337” Wonga) on the history of Ireland and the UK in this universe, trying to fill in the gaps for what BritishSocDem has already established 

Ireland 
In the 1970s, emigration to other, more “prosperous” states (like Europe and the UK) continue as in OTL
Ireland does not join the EU in this timeline, citing Irish Neutrality. However, they do participate economically. 
Inflation isn’t THAT bad in the 1970s, only becoming a problem in 1980
Ireland’s solution was to try to enact measures of austerity
Northern Ireland/the Troubles
Due to the more peaceful nature of the 70s and 80s, the Troubles are far less violent, but just as divisive. 
The 14 unarmed civilians are not killed on Bloody Sunday of 1972, instead they are held hostage and while injured and tortured, are not outright killed
Because of this, the UK government is a bit more open to negotiation with the rebels
This leads to an agreement in late 1972 where Northern Ireland is governed by two delegates: one from the UK and one from Ireland
This did not satisfy the most diehard members of either side, and in 1974, the truce is broken when a bomb is found in Stormont castle. No one is killed, but the UK uses this to suspend the treaty and implement direct force in Northern Ireland
Ireland responds by creating mass strikes, with the British soldiers sent to break up the strikes
US Presidential candidate Winston Morgan uses this a talking point for his campaign 
The UK fears this will spread a precedent and completely unravel the UK
In the later years, various bombings in places across Europe and the UK are carried out by Irish-aligned nationalists, with an estimated 200 dead and 15,000 wounded between 1968-1988
The Pope visits in 1975 to try to address the violence between catholics and protestants 
In 1981, sick of the perceived economic stagnation, a pro-trade, pro-eu and pro UK prime minister is elected in Ireland, and he signs the Shanghai Accords
This is seen as “selling out” to the UK, and causes violence to escalate in Northern Ireland
On May 1st, 1982, a massive bomb blows up the headquarters of several Irish businesses viewed as “collaborating” with the british 
This culminates in an official UN mission to negotiate a peace between Ireland, North Ireland, and London, with a series of talks taking place between 1983-1988. All can agree that a peaceful solution can be reached, though they disagree on how. 
Foreign investors in Ireland, and along with British money as a sort of peace offering, increases the standard of living of Ireland to be on par with the UK and the rest of Europe
The Irish Free state focuses on humanitarian aide during the troubles
A DMZ is set up along Northern Ireland in 1982, but is dismantled just a year later
In 1983, welfare reforms and tax cuts, along with immigration incentives, cause the Irish GDP to go up
Ireland makes money in the 1980s by exporting stuff like coal, copper, natural gas, metals, and food to europe 
After the Crash of 1988, trade deals with the UK fall through, leading to violence to pick up again. Most of the industry in the island of Ireland was concentrated in British-owned Northern Ireland, so the troubles sees a strange inverse - those in Northern Ireland, wanting to limp by with British welfare, try to remain a part of the UK, while those in Ireland want to “reunify with their northern cousins”. Nothing actually happens though, it’s just people shouting and arguing over foreign policy
This goes nowhere, and Ireland sees a massive drop in quality of life between 1988-1992. In 1992, a hardcore socialist is elected, and creates a massive welfare state with a focus on irish independence. They however, do not have the resources to take Northern Ireland, but they begin to covertly supply the PIRA 
In the 1990s, Ireland survives, but just barely. Sea walls are built in the 1990s and 2000s, but are targeted by nationalists. Famine is kept to a minimum, and the state officially is renamed to the Federal Socialist Republic of Ireland in 1997.

Former Activists during the Screaming Sixties are later called "Screamers”, although this applies less to bourgeois bohemians and more to those who still try to protest or even live in tiny hippie communes.

Comoros: 
Official name: Union of the Comoros (until 2006), State of Comoros (until 2014)
Capital: Moroni (until 2006), Hitlershaven (renamed from Dzaoudzi in 2006, until 2014)
Government Type: Unitary presidential republic (de jure until 1993), Mercenary-ruled state (until 2014)
Population as of final census conducted: 917,231 (1991)
Estimated Population as of June 14, 2027: 91,000
GDP as of June 7, 1988: $781 million
Primary Languages: Comorian, French, Afrikaans
Member of the Alliance of Nations: NO
Alignment: None
Great Death Survival Rating: Forgotten

Comoros had just been independent in 1974 after the French gave them independence (which was more given than OTL, OTL the Comorians unilaterally declared independence in 1975). However, this independence came at a cost. Mayotte remained under French rule as they didn’t want to join the rest of Comoros. Mayotte however, was home to a French-South African mercenaries group, ready to ensure the rest of Comoros remained under French control unofficially.

Comoros soon became a cheap plantation source for many crops such as vanilla, cinnamon, and others. Soon, Comoros also became the world’s biggest exporter of the plant ylang-ylang for perfumes. However, the people of Comoros weren’t fully feeling the supposed benefits that came from it. Sure, the government made sure to provide basic needs such as housing, food, healthcare, and others. However, most of the money remained within the elites of the nation and the mercenaries. The common Comorians never fully tasted that money.

From their independence to the crash of 1988, Comoros had experienced at least 4 attempted rebellions or coups. All of those were brutally squashed by the puppet military and the mercenaries. Still, life went on.

That was until the Crash of 1988.

At first, Comoros didn’t feel the straight effects from the crash. However, soon the exports began drying out. No one needed perfumes after the Crash. Spices were still exported, however they were less and less valuable over time. Food supply though, was getting lower. All of the abandoned plantations were quickly repurposed into farms for the people. However, overfarming led to decrease in quantity and quality. While it hadn’t reached emergency level yet, everyone began to worry about the future.

In 1993, the President of Comoros was shot dead by one of the military generals in a coup. This was the most successful coup so far with the general rallying the population against the foreigners. However, he miscalculated the mercenaries in the neighboring Mayotte. He thought they would abandon Comoros just like that. Big mistake.

Just a week after, the general was hanged in the capital alongside his circle. The coup was squashed. Mercenaries roamed the countryside to kill every single rebel or suspected rebels they could find. And it got worse.

The mercenaries now decided they didn’t need a puppet government. Comoros belonged to them now. Many of the former government and elites were purged of the suspected rebel alignment or any sign of discontent against the mercenaries. Comoros was now under the rule of foreigners again.

The mercenaries quickly established an authoritarian order. Strict rationing was implemented though the best food was clearly preserved for the mercenaries. Opulent houses were built out of the backs of the natives. Plantations were reopened though not to the degree of the Glorious Decades to export their crops to South Africa, the only nation willingly buying them. South Africa provided more aid for the mercenaries as they felt the mercenaries to be good rulers.

The French however gradually retreated from the Comoros. In December 1998, despite many pleas from Mayotte to Paris, Mayotte was officially united with Comoros and Paris officially pulled out of Comoros. The people of Mayotte however fared somewhat better than the rest of Comoros with the stable-ish transition. Plantations were kept open, but Mayotte fared looser rule under the mercenaries.

Eventually though, the mercenaries were increasingly seen as unwelcome by all of Comoros. Food was getting harder to get. Fishermen were increasingly returning with empty holds. And with the mercenaries hoarding all the food for themselves, resentment was building.

From 1998, a total of 8 attempted rebellions were squashed by the mercenaries. All of the rebels and suspected rebels were hanged in the fields and the towns. The mercenaries didn’t spare any mercy to those they suspected. Eventually, however, the mercenaries couldn’t hold the islands forever. Their weapons and ammunition were running low. The people were getting harder to control. Mass executions only made the dead martyrs instead of pacifying the islands.

In 2006, things finally changed. A major storm was predicted to hit the islands. Colonel Rand, the leader of the mercenaries finally decided to evacuate the islands to save themselves. On 12 December 2006, the storm hit, killing thousands of Comorians. However, when it passed on 14 December, they were free. Despite the harrowing destruction, the Comorians were finally free from the mercenaries. The mood was so jubilant despite them having to remove the ruins after the storm. A new government was soon declared on the Dzaoudouzi of Mayotte. The Comorians were set on establishing a new government for themselves.

They celebrated too soon.

On 18 December, a new group landed on the shores of Comoros. When they found out about the supposedly new government, they immediately opened fire on every single Comorians they could find. Within 2 days, the entire new government was executed. Within a week, the islands were properly pacified once more. At least 67,000 were killed during the pacification, roughly 6% of the estimated population.

The darkest time had come into Comoros. The previous mercenaries at least were merely kleptocratic, caring more about food and money rather than themselves. The new ones were worse.

Colonel Rand of the previous mercenary didn’t return to the Comoros after evacuating. Rumours said he was executed in the mainland for not properly pacifying the “inferior blacks”. Instead, someone who was merely called the General came to rule over the islands. The General was someone who fully believed in the ideology of the newly renamed GAR in South Africa.

Within months, Dzaoudzi was cleared of “unnecessary” natives. Those that remained were essentially slaves for the mercenaries. Dzaoudzi was renamed into Hitlershaven since the General felt such an “African” name didn’t fit for their new home. They also fully removed the veneer and simply renamed Comoros as the State of Comoros. The displaced were the first group to be put into newly-reopened slave plantations. Conditions were horrid to say the least. While the first mercenaries tried to provide food by strict rationing and healthcare, the new ones totally didn’t. They must look for their own food, not even planting them. Any unauthorized crop was punished with death. Any unauthorized fishing was punished with death.

Needless to say, scores of Comorians quickly died out within months of their reign. At least 25% of the population died within the first year of their rule. To replace them, the mercenaries imported thousands of foreign Africans from the mainland and Madagascar. The Comorians were increasingly becoming less of a majority in their own lands. Comoros had regressed into the times of Spanish Hispaniola, this time with Nazism and Afrikaner racism.

Any attempted riot or rebellion were punished with death. The mercenaries didn’t even bother at sorting between the innocent or guilty. Even children as young as 8 years old were put into plantations.

Eventually, it deteriorated enough in the 2010s or so when reports of cannibalisms began to emerge. The enslaved population began to eat on their sickly and old ones. First it was voluntary, but more and more were committed  out of desperation.

And what were the mercenaries' reactions ? Laughing at the Africans’ faces. They felt it was only proper that the inferiors ate their own and the Master Race ate real food. They even executed more to provide more food to the slaves.

Despite this draconian condition, it was getting harder to justify continued occupation of the islands. More and more of the goods imported weren’t of enough quality and then quantity. There were talks of abandoning the islands to their fate.

And it happened in November 2014. A major storm once again was tracked to hit the Comoros. The mercenaries had decided to pull out, abandoning the islands completely. Coincidentally, Comoros had just received more imported workers from the mainland just a week earlier.

The storm hit on 28 November 2014. Hitlershaven alongside every other settlement and plantations in Comoros were destroyed. Every boat remaining was sunk. There wasn’t any building left standing or undamaged by the storm.

When the storm settled, conflict began to break out between what remained of the former slaves. Some tried to build boats or anything to escape the islands. However, the depleted resources made those attempts very important. A civil war broke out in the islands. Within months, the majority of Comoros either died or escaped by improvised boats, many dying in the sea as well.

By 2027, Comoros was just a shell of itself. Less than 100 thousand remained in the ruined islands. Only about 10% of them were native Comorians. They were completely abandoned to their fate.

Equatorial Guinea:
Official name: Republic of Equatorial Guinea
Capital: Malabo (until 2012)
Government Type: United presidential republic (de jure until 2012), Totalitarian dictatorship (de facto until 2012)
Population as of final census conducted: 1,4 million (estimated, 1990s)
Estimated Population as of June 14, 2027: 173,000
GDP as of June 7, 1988: $561 million
Primary Languages: Spanish (until 1993), French (until 1993), Portuguese (until 1993), Fang, etc
Member of the Alliance of Nations: NO
Alignment:  Mediterranean Economic Alliance (until 1993)
Great Death Survival Rating: Forgotten

Equatorial Guinea weren’t exactly receiving the bountiful effects of the Glorious Decades. The dictatorial rule under Francisco Nguema wasn’t exactly the most positive time during Equatorial Guinea’s time of existence. Despite Moscow, Beijing, and Madrid forcing Nguema to be somewhat mellower, Equatorial Guinea didn’t feel the elevated prosperity during the time. 

Instead, many of its population were exploited heavily for its cocoa, coffee, and timber. Various corporations from Europe and America opened up shops as the population was used to plant those crops. Overfarming began to show its effect even before just the Crash of 1988. During the time, Nguema would deliberately use non-Fang tribesmen such as the Bubi people in the island of Santa Isabel to grow the crops. It was said Santa Isabel was cleared of Bubi people in the 1980s or 1990s.

After the Crash of 1988, Equatorial Guinea initially didn’t receive heavy impacts from it as its oil deposit were heavily exploited, replacing the drying plantations' incomes. Luxurious mansions and such were built for Nguema and his inner circle in Santa Isabel and the mainland. However, Malabo was increasingly becoming a city only for Nguema and his inner circle. Its population was basically serfs for them.

With that money, Equatorial Guinea barely weathered the Hot Summer. Despite this, many of its people starved to death, notably non-Fang people. Droves of Bubi and other tribes died due to starvation while the Fang people barely survived.

However, when the oil finally dried out in 1993, Nguema finally returned to his horrible self. Every single Westerner was expelled. Any of those who remained were killed in 1995. Many Equatoguineans closely associated with Westerners during the Glorious Decades were arrested. Many were killed by the end of 1990s. His prisons were so overfilled by prisoners some were executed daily to reduce the space.

Spanish and other Western languages were outlawed in 1993. Any book written in those languages were banned too and those who owned them might simply disappear if they didn’t dispose of them in time.

Cuba aided Equatorial Guinea briefly during the 1990s. However, they pulled out with the insane excesses of Nguema’s dictatorship. They were horrified by the insane dictatorship and pulled out every single personnel to save them. It’s rumoured they even brought some very desperate refugees from Equatorial Guinea.

The Catholic Church faced heavy restriction in the Glorious Decades. All of its priests were bugged and told to praise Nguema in every mass. Eventually, they were banned in 1995. All of its priests were sent to prisons in 1996. By 2000, the Catholic Church rankings in Equatorial Guinea were extinct.

To replace the Cubans, Nguema brought in mercenaries from across Africa. They, alongside Nguema’s inner circle members, would rule over Equatorial Guinea as it was breaking down. The purges against the military and government would see mercenaries taking place as governors and armed forces leaders in some places in Equatorial Guinea.

Despite this, Nguema was increasingly getting paranoid. He felt the Spanish, the Cubans, the French, and others were coming for him. He became increasingly isolated in his mansion in the island of Bioko, abandoning the capital in 1998 to his mansion.

Order was breaking down in Equatorial Guinea as people were starving. Many of the government apparatuses were gone. Mercenaries were killing people with impunity. Even simple felonies such as crashing into a mercenary could get you shot.

Nguema began to lose trust in his inner circle and family too. In August 1999, he executed the entire line of his brother including Obiang, his nephew. Their bodies were fed upon the starving population of Malabo. Many of his ministers and others were executed too for no clear reason other than Nguema’s paranoia. They were also turned into food for the population.

In the mainland, farms began to fail after overcropping. Food supply began to run low. Fishes were getting harder to catch. It was as if the end was approaching near for Equatorial Guinea.

Then, it happened. Nguema died.

In June 2000, Nguema was reportedly visiting the prisoners in his personal jail in his mansion. This was a known habit of his, visiting, berating, torturing, and executing prisoners. This time, he was accompanied by his daughter, Monica Macias. She was one of his closest and most loyal confidants. However, after an unspecified psychotic break, he reportedly picked up an AK-47 and fired upon the entire jail, dumping its magazines to kill every single prisoner there.

After the massacre was over, Nguema was reportedly grinning, heavily disturbing Monica. 

It was unclear what happened next. However, it was reported Monica then suddenly shot Nguema. Soon after that, he bled out. Nguema had died ingloriously.

What came next might actually be worse for Equatorial Guinea.

Monica quickly gathered her wits. Within a week, her family was put to death. Her mother, her siblings, and the rest of her father’s family. All were purged. Similarly, every single governor and top mercenary leaders were purged to prevent any of her father’s aligned faction against her.

Anyone left was just a yes-man to her rule. Monica had assumed total control by August 2000.

For a brief period, things were actually getting somewhat better for Equatoguineans. Order was re-established. Strict rationing was implemented. Farms were reopened. Security was established. However, things were not so free there. Anyone could easily be imprisoned for a simple matter. The prisons were still cauldrons of crimes against humanity. Monica had simply put a little order to the collapsing nation.

And it was about to get worse.

Even with strict order, farms were still failing. Crops failed to grow. Heavy rains and floods washed settlements and farms away. Fishes were getting harder and harder to catch. Even substance gathering began to dry out.

Here, Monica was about to turn even more horrifying than her father.

Every Bubi people ranging from 50 years above were gathered and killed. They were turned into food for the people. And then 40 years. And then the rest. Finally all of them were gone.

Other groups faced similar treatment. Any enemies of Monica were turned into food. Prisoners were turned into food. Anyone who disagreed was turned into food. By 2008, any intellectuals other than the most trusted were turned into food. Any possession of things indicating one as intellectual was punished by death. No one else was smarter than Monica. No one.

Monica was as paranoid, if not more, as her father was. No one knew exactly why Monica turned this way. However, one of the last surviving bodyguards (he was purged in 2011) told stories of the time Monica killed Nguema. It was said Nguema cursed her to suffer forever. She shall not find any peace in life, Nguema said before he was dead.

Any rebellions were quickly squashed and the rebels were turned into food. Any dissenting voice was gone. The mercenaries were similarly turning into psychos themselves. Equatorial Guinea was literally run by madmen now.

In 2012, it all would end. Malabo and the island of Bioko received an unusually heavy amount of rain. The storm threatened to destroy and wipe out the entire island. Facing this, Monica and what’s left of her inner circle evacuated the island, leaving the rest to die. However, their ship capsized in the ocean, leaving their fate unclear.

It was said Monica actually survived the capsizing and washed ashore. The people, for one last time, rose up, and brutally butchered her. Nothing was left of her by the time they were done. Nothing could be confirmed. The mainland fell into fiefdoms of psychotic mercenary warlords who ruled over the starving, decimated people. Eventually, all of them would fall either by uprisings or internal schisms, replaced by total anarchy. 

The island of Bioko was abandoned, Malabo became a graveyard as a remainder of both of the Nguemas’ rule. What’s left of the survivors either killed themselves, killed others before killing themselves, or went away by boats, surviving or not.

By 2027, Equatorial Guinea as a nation was no more. Its people were scattered and decimated by the rules of the Nguemas and the mercenaries after them.

Polish People’s Republic : Gierek era continues as the West, not strapped for cash due to no Oil Crisis, keeps tossing him cash so he can keep building shit. He probably retires in the mid 1980s (in glory, seen by Warsaw Pact as a visionary for having adopted proto-market socialism before the rest) and is replaced by a semi competent underling (perhaps Kania?), who in turn is replaced by a Junta similar to OTL in 1988 after the economy collapses and the West demands their cash back - after refusal they cut ties and the Warsaw Pact’s economies flatline. Tons of dissidence but unorganized (due to higher prosperity Solidarity never exists), Far Right starts gaining traction. The Soviets initially try to help but give up after Turkestan turns into the water hazard level from HL2. By 2000, the Warsaw Pact basically dosen’t exist, with only the old Soviet Bloc, Yugoslavia, Turkey and Scandinavia holding on (with a ,,hang together or be hung separately” mentality). Poland’s regime collapses in the late 2000s as the economy completely collapses and the peasantry riots, replaced by Far Right Regime (Maybe led by Marian Kowalski? Decently popular as bodybuilder in OTL, had monetary backup, unlikely to be butterflied - prob. Richer thanks to the opening up in the 1980s). The rest goes along with this, not wanting to waste valuable resources on basically couping the country. Poland turns from a Communist Regime into a Corporatocracy, although one where people are given some welfare (at the insistence of the Catholic Church, and because the Polish Right was always held up by the conservative poor who like to not starve). The Polish Intelligence Service figures out the USSR is doing shady shit (in the leadup to the Great Death) but lack the ability to properly analize what exactly. Poland leads the People’s Coalition (still holding on by 2027, and actually headquartered in the city instead of Moscow) to intervene in the European Civil War to help East Germany loot umm i mean reclaim the rest of the country, and most of their army is abroad when the Nukes hit.
